I understand beds sink over time, but it should probably be replaced. The shower curtain is a very thin material and it looks like it can tear easily so be careful when pulling it back. The floors are wood and tile, so if you visit in the winter be careful with your shoes and be mindful of the winter salt/melting snow. Also, for those not used to city living, there are two doors when entering the building, the first door must close before the second door can unlock. If the first door is held open or hasn't shut, the second won't open at all.
would recommend!
Very nice place to stay, easy access. Would recommend.
Ish is a kind and responsible host, clean room and commendations for guests!
Excellent emplacement et apparement très cozy!
Emplacement idéal au centre ville de Montréal, pratique et convivial.

name: Mokapu Oasis
summary: Newly renovated small private studio unit with AC. Walking distance to the beach and shopping mall with a grocery store, coffee shop and plenty of dining options. Great for single or double occupancy, Queen bed, Kitchenette with a Refrigerator and Microwave, Cable TV, WiFi, Washer and Dryer, Private yard space, Cooler, Boogie boards, Beach chairs, BBQ grill, near Kaneohe Bay Marine  Corps Base. If you're not a beach lover, the studio is surrounded by beautiful Golf courses too.
space: Studio unit is attached to the main house but has it's own private entrance.
description: Newly renovated small private studio unit with AC. Walking distance to the beach and shopping mall with a grocery store, coffee shop and plenty of dining options. Great for single or double occupancy, Queen bed, Kitchenette with a Refrigerator and Microwave, Cable TV, WiFi, Washer and Dryer, Private yard space, Cooler, Boogie boards, Beach chairs, BBQ grill, near Kaneohe Bay Marine  Corps Base. If you're not a beach lover, the studio is surrounded by beautiful Golf courses too. Studio unit is attached to the main house but has it's own private entrance. Driveway is shared with the main house. Parking stall designated to studio is closest to the unit.  Fresh bath towels, beach towels, and beach chairs are available for use.  Kitchenette comes with microwave, hot plate with 2 pans/pots, 4 cup rice cooker, dishes and cups, and cutting board with knives. I am currently out of state but my Father in law is taking care of the main house while I am away.   His name is Joe, whom loves golf and
neighborhood_overview: Great and safe family neighborhood located near a busy street, so you may occasionally hear traffic.  Although if you are in the unit with the A/C on and windows closed, you shouldn't hear a thing.
notes: Easy Self Check in
transit: If you don't have a car which is highly recommended so that you can explore all that the island has to offer. There is public transportation by bus just outside the property that runs directly to Ala Moana Mall. Uber or Lyft are also great options.
access: Driveway is shared with the main house. Parking stall designated to studio is closest to the unit.  Fresh bath towels, beach towels, and beach chairs are available for use.  Kitchenette comes with microwave, hot plate with 2 pans/pots, 4 cup rice cooker, dishes and cups, and cutting board with knives.
interaction: I am currently out of state but my Father in law is taking care of the main house while I am away.   His name is Joe, whom loves golf and will be a great host.   You will be able to reach me by phone and I will make arrangements for Joe or someone else to assist you with any needs.
house_rules: - No Shoes in the house (Hawaiian Style) - Quiet Hours are from 10pm-8am -DO NOT flush wipes or feminine products down the toilet, it WILL cause back ups and plumbing issues during your stay. (i.e. flushable wipes, feminine wipes, baby wipes, cleaning wipes, PLEASE NO WIPES)  - Parking is limited to 1 driveway stall (nearest studio unit)

reviews.comments: Phillip's house was great. He was out of town so his father Joe was there to help us and he could not have been any nicer. The place is clean and quiet. Everything is extremely nice to the point that the pictures don't even do it justice. The bathroom is great, the bedroom is set up well, and the tv is awesome. Also, the ac keeps the apartment nice and cold for when you get back from the beach. We will definitely book here next time we are on Oahu.

We had a wonderful stay at Philips place during our time in Oahu. Self check in was easy, and the place was extremely clean and cozy. It had everything we were looking for. Although we never met Philip, he was always just a text or call away and very accommodating to our needs. His father lives in the house next door and is the nicest man ever! Mahalo to the both of them.

If my husband & I can write a book about our amazing experience at this place we called home for 7 days we definitely could!

Philip & Kawena's place is by far our most favorite Airbnb we've ever stayed at! Here are a few reasons why:

1) Philip & Kawena were very quick to respond to any questions we had prior to booking the place. 
2) We were celebrating our Babymoon (honeymoon before our 1st child arrives) & the studio had the perfect space we needed. The place is conveniently set up for only 1-2 people! 
3) The studio was extremely clean. Linens and towels looked professionally folded. The details were impeccable.
4) The AC was a big plus. Additionally to they provided us a fan which we used when we wanted to open the screen door to get some fresh air in or when we were cooking a meal.
5) The kitchen was complete with everything we needed, including the rice cooker & utensils. 
6) The keyless entry - this made it very convenient for us to go in & out without having to look for a physical key.
7) My own personal requests - a day or two before our trip, I asked if we could borrow a cooler and a beach umbrella ... before we arrived there, I got a message from Kawena and everything was set! We were so overwhelmed with gratitude. Along with the backpack beach chairs and beach towels.  Our trip would not have been as enjoyable without these accommodations. Plus, when we opened the freezer, a bag of ice was ready for us to take to the beach!
9) The beach was walking distance too! Kailua and Lanikai Beach were only 5 mins away via driving. 
10) We had a designated parking spot!
11) The Hawaiian Hospitality - our host's parents (Joe and his wife) were very cordial and greeted us with the biggest Aloha Greeting! They definitely made our Airbnb experience one of a kind!!!!

Thank you for this wonderful experience!!! We will cherish these memories forever. 

Mahalo!!! Charles, Kris & Baby

My husband and I really enjoyed staying at this airbnb.  It was super clean and cute.  It contained all the necessities for a perfect Hawaiian vacation.  There were very nice beach towels, beach chairs, and umbrella, all in new or excellent condition.  The bed was also very comfortable which isn't always expected.  The location of the unit was very private although being attached to a single family home.  We felt like we had ample privacy.  It suited us perfectly and Joe was amazingly welcoming and hospitable!!!  We recommend this airbnb highly and if we ever get chance to go to Hawaii again we would definitely stay there again.  Amazing price for quality.

The best and most Incredible Airbnb. The Studio apartment was so clean you could eat off the floor lol. It had a great location where you can walk to Safeway grocery story in 4 minutes and the beach in 8-10 minutes. There are buses right in front of the place which is also convenient. In the studio, we were provided with high quality beach chairs and beach towels along with a parasol. The bathroom was very very clean. When we arrived, Joe who takes care of the place who lives next door is one of the kindest and humble humans my mother and I have ever met. The moment we got there he made us feel like family and was there for us whenever we needed. I would go back to Oahu just to stay there!!!

This place was awesome and had everything we needed as a home base after a long day of exploring the island! Everything was very clean and the amenities were great. Joe was also very friendly and helpful, made us feel right at home!
Great place and wonderful hosts! Location is amazing, close to the nices beaches, near restaurants and Safeway. We had a perfect vacation.

My boyfriend and I spent our first time in hawaii at Philips place and don’t have One single complaint we could possibly make. The place is not huge - but perfect for two, and with the amount of time we spent there it had all we needed! 5 minute walk to the beautiful and quiet Castles beach and a 12 minute drive to world famous Lanikai. Central location to all - we saw the entire Island. Super close to tons of good food (recommend Konos + Teddys Burgers highly) and attractions. Philip was always a text away and his father Joe who lived there was beyond friendly, and also gave us privacy. If you’re low maintenance, love adventure and sight seeing - this is for you!
C est juste parfait! La chambre est bien décorée c est très propre je conseils à tout le monde de venir

This place far exceeded our expectations.  You can tell the owners thought about what people would want and need while on vacation and made sure it was there. From beach gear to laundry machines, this place was amazing. If we ever come back to Oahu, we will stay there instead of a hotel. It was phenomenal.
Amazing place!  So clean and quiet.  Close to beach.  Just PERFECT!

Beautyful little apartment, very good equiped, very clean and close to wonderful beaches + to a small shoppingcenter. Philip and Kawena responded very quick to all our requests and Joe is very very very kind and a great host, if we could we would like to adopt him. :0) We had a great stay for two weeks and would come again.

This place is just perfect! We stayed here with my husband on our honeymoon for 8 days and we couldn’t have choosen better. The place had everything we wanted and even more. It is on a very good location. We could walk to the shops, restaurants and beach, and also drive around the entite island as the highways are easily accessible. Joe was super kind and super helpful, it was a pleasure meeting him. We would definately come back again and stay here.

We enjoyed staying at Philip's place. It is cozy and clean- and has everything you need - things for the beach, washer/dryer. We had a car, but there was a bus stop right out front. Kailua is a great place to visit, and this was a good home base to explore the southeast part of the island.

We had a wonderful stay at Philip's place! Very clean and cozy. We didn't end up walking to the beach, so I am not sure how close it is. We ended up driving to Kailua Beach which was only a 10 minute drive away. Will definitely stay again!

Wonderful hosts! So nice to meet the whole family, we really felt like we were at home over the holidays. We stayed for two weeks and were very comfortable, terrific location. We rented bikes and rode into town and to Lanikai beach and all over Kailua. The hosts had a cooler, beach chairs, boogie board and beach towels. Perfectly stocked for the beach! Full size fridge was helpful to store our beers from the local breweries. We only made breakfasts at the house and ate dinners out, but there was a BBQ we could have used on our own private patio. I would recommend this home to anyone who loves to spend time in town or at the beach. Best hosts ever! We will totally go back :)

This place is simply darling! It's easy to access and close to the freeway, as well as all other main attractions in the Kailua region (beach, Lanikai beach, pillbox hike, Whole Foods, Food Land and other groceries, restaurants). The place is small but feels very spacious. The bed is super comfortable. Having a laundry machine and dryer in house was a hug plus for us. The kitchette is well equipped with a good hot plate, electric tea kettle, coffee maker, pans, great knives and plates/bowls/utensils. Very clean place. Owners are wonderful and very welcoming. I wanted to extend my trip here but will have to just come again!

This place for us, was rated off the charts! The look and feel of the apartment was amazing. You get your own little entrance with a bbq, table and chairs! The suite has amazing air conditioning, full fridge, washer and dryer which was so handy for us. Make sure to use the chairs and umbrella that they provide! It makes your beach days that much more enjoyable! They even provide towels! Joe and his wife hiva were absolutely incredible. They’re the most welcoming and friendly people we have ever met! We can’t wait to come back!

A nice & neat place located on a quiet residential area. Safeway is  just across the street, and the Kailua beache is  only  5 mins (driving) away. Philip's father-in-law, Joe, is a nice old man, had knocked on the door to greet me on the day of my arrival. He  told me that he lives in the main house, and let him know if I need anything. They have beach chairs & towels for me to use., but unfortunate I didn't get to use them. I would stay with them again if I ever go back to Oahu.

This place is perfect. It was clean and cozy. It was far enough from the city that so no riff raff but close enough I could travel to it often. Joe, the man living in the main house is absolutely the sweetest man and will make sure you are completely taken care of. Definitely would recommend to everyone. Single or double no more.
A great spot close to everything and great hosts. Would recommend this to everyone. Very clean and well thought out room and private. Will definitely stay there again when we return!

This place was great and had SO many amenities for us to use! They had everything we would have needed for our Hawai’i trip! Very cute and cozy place. Would definitely come back and stay again! 10/10 would recommend!

Warm, welcoming, calm & relaxing space.

The beach supplies are great!  Chairs, boogie boards, umbrella & rolling cooler makes it easy to have a great day!  (Forgot beach towels?  No problem!  There’s 2 there!)

If using the bus, the stop is literally in front of the house!  Or, walk 10 minutes to beach access - one of the most beautiful white sand beaches I’ve ever been to.  

Overall, one of the most wonderful times I’ve had with the husband - we had the opportunity to reconnect in a way that we wouldn’t have been able to, in a hotel.

Lovely hosts - warm & welcoming!

Everything was just perfect. We had no car, but the bus stop is just in front of the house. Near to the beach and grocery stores (walking distance). Joe is such a lovely and friendly person. You can also find beach towels, beach chairs and other cool stuff for a nice day on the beach in the apartment.
Thank you so much for a wonderful vacation to my favorite place in Oahu! It was perfect for my needs

Joe and his wife are fantastic hosts! Greeted with hugs and smiles. Room was everything we could have hoped for! Great location. Superbly clean and supplied everything you need for the stay. Highly recommend. I’ll be staying there again!

This place is FANTASTIC! Super clean, great location, comfortable bed, air conditioning, free parking, and great tips for where to go! Philip was very responsive and easy to communicate with. His dad, Joe, was very kind welcoming. I know this place is listed as a “private room” but it really is it’s own separate apartment! You have a separate entrance with your own living space that includes a private bathroom, kitchen, fridge, washer and dryer, tv, etc! We absolutely loved it and when we come back we will 100% book this place again! 
Thanks Philip!

It is a short walk to the beach.  It has air conditioning and fans. It is clean and new, and a short walk to Safeway.  The small patio is private. The experience was pleasant, and Kewana’s father in law was very hospitable.

Great place! My girlfriend and I stayed here for a few nights and it was perfect for the two of us. They had boogie boards and beach chairs and towels for us too. Plus in addition to the microwave there is a small stove top and pans. It was walking distance to the beach and a grocery is super close by. The hosts were super super friendly too! Overall great place

Awesome place in Kailua. Really close to the beaches on the Kailua coast. 10-15 min drive to Lanikai and to the shops. The place is very comfy and clean with A/C (awesome for hot days). Big T.V. with cable and comfy bed. Big fridge too store frozen and perishable foods. You can wake up and walk to the beach for sunrises and if you need any advice Philip can answer any questions. Philip's dad Joe is the best, very personable and friendly and will help if you have any questions. Would definitely recommend friends, family, and anyone to stay again!

Everything was absolutely awesome!!!  From the private parking in driveway, to the small, quaint and magnificently clean place.  We loved the fact that there were all of the basic necessities like shampoo, hair dryer, washer/dryer, soap...even had chairs for beach and body boards.  Bedding was super clean and phenomenally comfortable. Phil/Joe were extremely prompt in answering any questions we had.  I highly recommend this place for any and all to experience; Maholos
Absolutely amazing place! By far one of the best AirBnb’s i’ve stayed at. Extremely welcoming, very clean and very cozy place! 10/10 would without a doubt stay here again:)

This place is great! Easy self check-in. It's clean and comfortable. The bed is amazing. You have everything you need: fridge, washer, dryer, coffee maker, coffee, toaster, etc. The family is so sweet. If you're using public transportation, the bus stop is right outside the drive way. The place was quiet. I had a lovely stay. I would absolutely come back here and would recommend this place to anyone traveling here.

Most comfortable and prettiest airbnb ever!! Hopefully we can return soon.  
Everything was just PERFECT!!! Really recomend staying at Philips. Kailua and his place are the best!!

We really enjoyed staying at Mokapu Oasis. It was cozy and clean and had everything we needed to be comfortable. It was very convenient for shopping, the beach, hiking etc.  We love Kailua and the windward side of the island so this place was ideal!
Fantastic place!

Great Location! Close to Beach and Amenities and a very welcoming Host! Totally enjoyed our stay here!
April
Love then place! Soo cute cozy and clean.

Great hosts who are very attentive and responsive! We loved staying here. It’s close to the best beaches on the island! (or at least our favorite) The suite was super clean, private, and comfortable. Philip created a lovely atmosphere for our desired price point and we would definitely recommend it to anyone.

I have lived in the area for several year and caneback to the island to visit. Let me tell you, the value for this Airbnb is amazing. A/C is a rarity in the island. Joe was amazingly sweet and gave us the warmest welcome and send off. 

The place has everything you could need, they really thought of everything.  Beach chairs, umbrella, beach towel, cooler.. the list goes on. They even included a discount card to the grocery store across the street.
The place was so clean, and so convenient both in location and check-in/out. Would definitely stay here again in the future. The bed was extremely comfortable and the kitchenette well equipped.

They have a great location, close to the freeways, close to the beach, stores, restaurants and even coffee! The hospitality was incredible, they thought of everything and didn’t skimp. This was probably my best Air B&B yet and we have used them across the globe!
Great little place, close to everything we needed. Super clean, comfy bed, cute little patio out front. Will stay here again!

Philip was very easy to communicate with. He provided all the information you need. The house is exactly as you see it. Perfect home away from the city close to the beach. The bus stop is right outside the home if you don’t have a car. Philip’s father was very kind and helpful. I would highly recommend this home for any guests.

I had a very pleasant experience at Philip’s home. Cute studio, perfect for a few day stay, while only 1-2 miles from tons of eateries. Philip was away, but his father Joe was around, and he is very friendly and helpful with any questions I had. Parking in the driveway. I enjoyed the amenities the apartment comes with such as a beach chair and umbrella with a bodyboard, cooler, fridge and freezer, washer and dryer, strong quiet AC unit. Can’t go wrong while vacationing in the Kailua area. The Lanikai pillbox hike and beach is beautiful. I recommend over easy for breakfast, Nalu for lunch, buzz’s is another option and Uahi grill for dinner.

Our stay was fantastic, we really loved the place!!! It's great studio for exploring the island (much better location than staying in the busy Waikiki). I would highly recommend this place. I have stayed in many Airbnbs and this place was super-clean,well equiped and check-in/out was super easy. If we go back to Oahu, I would definitely choose it again!

Wir waren rundum zufrieden mit der Unterkunft. Wir haben unseren Gastgeber zwar nicht getroffen, aber seinen Vater, der super nett war und wir haben uns sehr willkommen gefühlt.
Das Studio ist schön eingerichtet, sehr sauber und verfügt über alles was man so benötigt inklusive Strandstühle etc. Es ist zwar an der Straße gelegen, aber nicht laut. Den Kailua Beach erreicht man mit dem Auto in 5-10 Minuten und den Lanikai Beach in 10-15, daher war die Lage für uns optimal. Parkplatz für das Auto war ebenfalls vorhanden.
Wir werden auf jeden Fall wiederkommen.
Joe was so friendly and welcome us to the home! He gave great local recommendations and was an outstanding host.

My wife and I wanted to explore different parts of the island and stayed a night at Philip's. The location was perfect, a short walk to the beaches and less than a 5-minute drive from some great restaurants. The apartment was very nice, comfortable, clean, and letting us use beach towels and boogie boards was nice touch. I would highly recommend the apartment for anyone who's looking to spend time in that part of O'ahu.

This is a very cozy, clean and charming place to stay.  It was very clean and had everything we needed!  The bed is super comfortable and the A/C makes it a great place to get a good night's sleep after a day of exploring.  The house was easy to find and was in a great location to get out and see the rest of the island.  There is a grocery store across the street and they even leave a discount card for you to use there.  Joe was super friendly and understanding when our plane was delayed and even met us out front when we arrived with a warm welcome!  We would definitely stay here again. Kailua is a cute town with great beaches and places to eat.

Philip and Kawena's unit is absolutely perfect! It has all you need in a very smart, well thought out, compact space. The A/C is amazing for the hot Hawaiian humidity, the bed is super comfortable, TV is great and kitchenette is just right. 
 Joe who took care of us is the definition of a super host, very attentive and is a great source of knowledge about the area and island. The beach and supermarket are a 5min walk and a short drive to shopping malls and the airport. Would definitely stay in the unit again and highly recommend to others you will not be disappointed.

We loved everything about this little gem and would return in a heartbeat!
It’s walking distance to the beach, Safeway and a few restaurants.

Thanks for letting us park in your driveway.  I was amazed that we also had a private yard and bbq!

Inside could not have been done any better! Every bit of space had a purpose.  The decor was great, the bed comfy and had laundry!  Loved the flooring.  We left a floatie and some snorkel gear for the next guest.  I hope they enjoy your place as much as we did. Thanks again!

Amazing place to stay! It was in the middle of everything and so easy to get to a freeway. Very close access to a beautiful beach that was not crowded. There were boogie boards, beach towels, beach chairs and a cooler to use which we did! Washer and dryer in the room was great to have as well. Stay here and you won't be disappointed!

If youre thinking about staying here, DO IT. The place is the nicest, with beaches and stores within walking distance. The space has all you need for a great stay. The A/C and washer/dryer are great perks too! Phillips mother is adorable and we loved meeting her.

This is a lovely space with many amenities included. Functional kitchen included with basic cooking supplies and coffee/tea. Beach towels, chairs, umbrella, and boogie boards are a great touch to have available. The hosts communicate quickly and are pleasant. We had a lovely vacation and would rent here again.

A wonderful place to stay with all essential amenities provided. Philip was generous in providing beach amenities as well. He was also very prompt in replying to questions. 
Location was ideal as it was very close to the beach, restaurants, grocery stores etc.
Will definitely stay here again during our next visit.
Very nice appartment with everything you need.

Location is perfect since it's close to Kailua and Lanikai beach. Room was very clean, spacious with a very comfortable bed. Beach paraphernalia such as chairs, umbrella, cooler, beach towels etc were very much appreciated! Bathroom had good amount of space and was very clean as well. Hosts responded very quickly. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and hope to stay here again on our next Oahu visit!

Future travelers can expect to enjoy a very clean space with a little private yard. The space felt very comfortable and you can enjoy easy access to the beach. Philip's father lives next door and is incredibly kind if you happen to cross paths with him. We really enjoyed being close to the Down to Earth local grocery store. It's my favorite grocery store ever. I wish we had one on the mainland.

We really enjoyed our stay in Kailua. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. Hosts were always available to answer questions. The place is a great base for for exploring O’ahu. We would stay again.

Mahalo for being so welcoming to us during our stay. Joe greeted us after a long day of flying. The room was perfect for us, clean and everything we needed was available. I would recommend this place to everyone, you won’t be disappointed! Aloha!
We really enjoyed our stay. The location was superb. The place was very cozy and clean. We headed to Waikiki after our stay at Philip’s and realized how spoiled we were in Kailua!

Loved trying in this cozy studio apartment! It was perfect for us and it was nice to have the small kitchen to cook with! His father lives next door and was very accommodating to us, especially during the hurricane warning. The tv was also larger than expected and it was nice at night! Would definitely recommend.

A nice place to stay with essential amenities. Philip’s father-in-law lives next door and very prompt in replying to your question/request. Location was good as well. One thing i did’t like: not many but there are small ants in the room, found a few on the bed.

We have been traveling around the whole world using airbnb, and this is probably the coziest aribnb we ever experienced.  The aparment is located close to everything, beach, shops, resturants, you name it.  The bed was confy and big. Everything was clean and tidy. Joe living in the main house was so sweet, always making sure we had the best time  thank you so so much, we will be back!

The place is great. Right off a main street, but with direct access to your own studio which feels private with small table, chairs and BBQ. The studio was larger than expected and came equipped nicely with amenities, cable TV , and kitchenette. Only stayed 1 night in Kailua but Philips place is a great value and I highly recommend !

The space was perfect for two people, Joe was a great guy, met us right as we pulled up and chatted with us for a few minutes.  Easy to find, close to grocery stores, food, and the beach. Great spot for the money.
Beautiful little apartment. Sparkling clean with cold AC and a nice big TV. The hosts were very kind and welcoming!

What a great stay! Perfect location and everything we needed. The room is super clean as well. You can park your car next to the entrance and there's even a small private garden. Philip's father gave us a warm welcome and greeted us every day with a smile. Would definitely recommend this place!
Perfect accommodation for a stay in Kailua. Easy check-in, almost fully-equipped kitchen, BBQ, just perfect. I would totally recommend this place for all travelers.

This place is simply perfect! 
We stayed for 7 nights and had everything we Need there. Joe and Hiva are Great! The Place is very close to Kailua und beautiful Lanikai Beach. Kailua Town is Great , with a lot of Restaurants and supermarkets. We totally recomment this place, there is nothing to do better!
Great place to stay.
Great place, friendly host, close to the beach and easy access to other tourist attractions if you travel by car!

Clean bright studio! Located on a bigger road- but there is barely any traffic. So many lovely beaches and great places to eat. We explored the island but loved coming back to our cozy Airbnb to restore for the next day.

I only stayed for a day but I can tell you guys that Philip's place meets all your needs. Not only was it super clean and comfortable, all the amenities they listed were there. 10/10 would definitely stay here again for longer period of time and hit up the beaches nearby.
This is a lovely place with everything one can expect on a holiday. We were extremely comfortable and thoroughly enjoyed our stay - probably the most enjoyable stay on the entire island of Oahu!
great place to stay in

This was such a great place to stay. It has everything you need for a visit in Hawaii: full bathroom, washer & dryer, boogie boards, beach towels, beach chair and a beach umbrella.  There was also utensils, bowls, plates, fridge/freezer, microwave hot plate, pots/pans and rice cooker in the kitchen. There was no stove, but I ate out for all my meals. There is also an air conditioner, and a standing floor fan as well. I need a fan to sleep at night, so this was a huge plus for me. 

It was a 5-10 minute drive from Whole Foods, gas stations, and the center of all the action in Kailua. Even Driving to Honolulu was very convenient, IMO.  Check out the health food store “Down To Earth”. They have a few in different locations on the island. I ate there almost every day. They are a vegetarian/vegan organic health food store with an excellent hot bar and salad bar. It only took about 5-7 minutes from the apartment to get there. Gonna miss that store so much! 

The views everywhere you go are just incredible. I was glad to have this little retreat to come home to and recharge every night. I’m from a small town in South Carolina, so I prefer visiting big cities rather than living/staying in them. It was nice to escape the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and retreat to the apartment in the small town of Kailua. There is a dedicated parking space for the apartment in the driveway, so if you rent a car, you will always have a place to park.

Philip’s dad, Joe, met me outside as I pulled in on the first night. He was very friendly and welcoming. They felt like family, and I was sad to tell them goodbye. 

It was a short drive from Kailua Beach Park, and about 15 minutes to Lanikai beach.  Kailua Beach Park was my favorite beach. be sure to check (Hidden by Airbnb) map reviews for the different beaches all over the island. 

The house was on a main road, but I never heard traffic when I was there unless someone had super loud music or it was motorcycles zooming by at full throttle. It was cozy and felt very safe. This was the perfect place for my first visit to Hawaii. It was super clean and organized. I’m glad I found it - I will recommend it to anybody I know that’s considering visiting Oahu. I would come back for sure. 

Cleanliness, comfort, location and price are what make this apartment worth booking. Mahalo, Philip for such a great place to stay. Aloha!

What a beautiful place to stay! thank you so much to Joe for making us feel so comfortable! I will be recommending this place to all our friends back home. The little unit was spacious and walking distance to food and supermarket. again highly reccommemded by myself and my partner sam!
Great nice people. Very close to the beach

Philip’s place was the perfect place to stay in Kailua. The location was great and his in laws were so sweet and helpful. We also love that they have beach chairs, towels, umbrella, and even a cooler available. It made our beach trips so much easier. Highly recommend this place as it was so hard for us to leave.

We enjoyed from start to finish on this fine place. Parking in front of the door. The full package. We were there during thanksgiving and we were served a delicious meal and a super tasty dessert mmm from father Joe!  We also  appreciated the privacy we received. The location was superb, near the most beautiful beaches of Oahu ... A car is advisable, but not a must stop there a bus at the door and the sea is very close as well as the supermarket is within walking distance, as well as restaurants .
Great little place in a very good location. The place is overall very cozy and the bed was super comfortable. The hosts were very nice and the communication was quick and informative. Recommended!
Such a homey place to stay and the in-laws are very welcoming!
You will not find a nicer place for this price on Oahu. It had good parking with a great location. Away from the crowds of Honolulu,  yet close enough
Great place to stay in HA. Really loved the access to the cooler, beach chairs  and towels. Location is right by Safeway,  food, and freeway.  I would return here again in a heartbeat.

This place was perfect! It was clean and cute and had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. It’s in a great central location and is a great value. Perfect for a couple enjoying a week in Hawaii.
The host canceled this reservation 11 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We had a wonderful stay during the holidays at Philip's place in Kailua. So glad that we did not stay in Waikiki as the location was perfect for exploring all parts of the island (we had a rental car that made this possible). The studio was just the right size for the two of us- complete with everything but a full kitchen (which we didn't even need). Nice to have a fridge and microwave and basic utensils to heat up leftovers and make breakfast. Loved that we had beach towels, chairs and umbrella to take with us on outings and that there was a washer and dryer we could use. Philip's father in law, Joe was super friendly and made us feel very welcome in our air bnb. Yes, as other reviewers have said the house is located on a major street but we had our own parking spot on the driveway and we could not hear much noise at night time and slept well. The price is unbeatable! We would definitely recommend this place to any of our couple friends who are looking for a home away from home for a few days. Mahalo to Philip and his family for a lovely vacation!

I wanted to stay someplace outside of Honolulu and Waikiki but still close to the beach and I’m glad I found this place in Kailua.  

The place looks just as pictured and is very comfy and quaint enough for a solo traveler or low maintenance couple.  The place was clean, fresh linen, has a washer and dryer and refrigerator.  There was a Safeway grocery store and Burger King across the street, beach is a 10 mins walk.  

My only regret is that I didn’t rent a car (my first time there so I underestimated how big the island was) so I caught the bus into Honolulu and rode Uber back at night (the bus stops running at 9ish in that area).  Great if you want to stay in a quiet neighborhood-sy area but definitely rent a car so you can easily get to other parts of the island.  I would definitely stay here again.

Philip's place is a nice place for your vacation on Oahu. My wife and I enjoyed our time very much. We only met Joe, the father of the host, but he took good care of us. The place is very clean and exactly as pictured. I loved staying in Kailua away from the traffic and the crowds of Waikiki. Kailua Beach Park is a 5 minute drive from the apartment and offers a really nice beach with facilities and lifeguards. If you want to go to Haunama Bay it's just a 30 minute drive and to the airport it takes 25 minutes.
I can recommend this place and I will come back on my next stay.

If you are minimalist this is the perfect place for you.  Has just what you need, a great bed and affordable.  Close to grocery shopping with full fridge for easy breakfasts.  Used the beach chairs, umbrella, beach towels and boogie boards a great touch. Kailua beach very beautiful, close and uncrowded.

Very clean and cute place! Philip was very communicate and responded quickly. Also Joe was on the property and super friendly! Just a tip. The place is off a main road. Make a right into the drive way after the bus stop
I would suggest staying here.  It was perfection.
Easy checkin with door code, friendly host and good communication. Nice private space with great location near the beach
Great place! Would totally come back. Hospitable people and very clean and beautiful studio. All supplies available! Loved the white tea shampoo/soap!
Cute, clean and cozy! Perfect for my brief stay in Kailua although would also be great home base for a couple exploring the area!

Me and my fiancée stayed in Philip’s and Kawena’s Mokapu oasis for two nights and three days and their studio was amazing! Perfect for a couple who are looking for a nice cheaper alternative than a hotel. The pictures provided are exactly how the home looks. The place had everything to towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner. Also we were able to use their beach equipment, (beach chairs, umbrella and boogie board) which was awesome! We were also able to wash our clothes with the washer and dryer that is located in the unit! Which was awesome! We were provided with one parking space which was great and the place is located near many stores and shopping center which made buying  things so easy. Thank you for a great stay!!!
The space was very clean and met all of our needs. Joe was super friendly and an amazing host. We will definitely be back

It was great. Room was very clean and as big I needed it to be. Beach is a 10 min walk down the street. The street is a little noisy but they thought  ahead and have a fan there. Less than a block there are several places to eat. I was very happy with this place

name: New + historical apt with PRIVATE 360 ROOFTOP
summary: New apartment in a typical Montreal historical style building, located in trendy Villeray district. Quiet neighbourhood very close to many lively spots:  Jean-Talon market, Little Italy, Rosemont, place de Castelnau, and all the Villeray's super great indy stores, cafes & restaurants. You will be able to enjoy a PRIVATE ROOFTOP TERRASSE, with a 360 VIEW on Montreal !!! Plus super green & peaceful back of the apt. Less than 8mn walk to Jean Talon metro station & 12mn walk to Jarry metro station.
space: Check our fantastic reviews on the other listing we have, since this one is new, it has none for the moment. Accommodates up to 4 people.
description: New apartment in a typical Montreal historical style building, located in trendy Villeray district. Quiet neighbourhood very close to many lively spots:  Jean-Talon market, Little Italy, Rosemont, place de Castelnau, and all the Villeray's super great indy stores, cafes & restaurants. You will be able to enjoy a PRIVATE ROOFTOP TERRASSE, with a 360 VIEW on Montreal !!! Plus super green & peaceful back of the apt. Less than 8mn walk to Jean Talon metro station & 12mn walk to Jarry metro station. Check our fantastic reviews on the other listing we have, since this one is new, it has none for the moment. Accommodates up to 4 people. We are more than willing to have you get the best Montreal experience you will ever have, thus we are more than happy to respond any of your question or help you out during your stay. Quiet neighbourhood very close to many lively spots, within walking distance:  Jean-Talon market, Little Italy, Rosemont, place de Castelnau, and all the Villeray's super great i
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighbourhood very close to many lively spots, within walking distance:  Jean-Talon market, Little Italy, Rosemont, place de Castelnau, and all the Villeray's super great indy stores, cafes & restaurants. We are very fond of fooding and will be glad to leave plenty of business cards of the places we recommend for you to enjoy! Also, do not hesitate if you have specific things you're looking for, we'll be glad to advise, or help you finding your way to get around.
transit: Less than 8mn walk to Jean Talon metro station & 12mn walk to Jarry metro station. And many buses all around of course.
interaction: We are more than willing to have you get the best Montreal experience you will ever have, thus we are more than happy to respond any of your question or help you out during your stay.
house_rules: - Quiet hours from 10pm to 8am. No shoes in the house. Tenants must remain courteous with our neighbours and respectful of the environment that is offered. The neighbours are also owners of the same building. This place nor this terrasse are a suitable place for festive gatherings. Thank you for your respect and welcome to Montreal!

host.host_about: Have been living in France, China, Hong Kong, Canada - Set designer/Interior designer/Graphic Designer/Visual Artist - I love travelling and have interest in Ayurveda & Traditional Chinese Medicine, as well as Artistic & Cultural shows

reviews.comments: Great place. Clean, quiet and comfortable. Highly recommended. Really enjoyed it.
Appartement propre et bien situé !

name: Happy 3 bedrooms, 20 min downtown
summary: Apartment 3 separate rooms located on the 3rd floor ( no elevator) of a small building for up to 6 people, renovated and offers every comfort. It is located in a area close to all amenities 20 minutes from downtown. 15 min walk to HEC, UDEM or Polytechnique
space: Enjoy this beautiful 3 rooms of 65m2 full equipped on the 3rd floor of a small building in the heart of the Cotes des Neiges neighborhood. Free street parking. 6 people
description: Apartment 3 separate rooms located on the 3rd floor ( no elevator) of a small building for up to 6 people, renovated and offers every comfort. It is located in a area close to all amenities 20 minutes from downtown. 15 min walk to HEC, UDEM or Polytechnique Enjoy this beautiful 3 rooms of 65m2 full equipped on the 3rd floor of a small building in the heart of the Cotes des Neiges neighborhood. Free street parking. 6 people You will have access to the whole apartment The apartment is fully equipped to make you feel at home: - Free parking in the street - Fully equipped kitchen (complete dishes, refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster) - 3 Bedrooms closed and fully furnished (linens provided, two double bed and 1 queen bed) - There is no living room - Bathroom with bathtub - Pay Laundry in the building ($ 1.50) - Smoking not allowed (only on balcony) - Pets not allowed - Internet unlimited Wi-Fi Everything is at your disposal so you have a pleasant stay! The check in is at 4pm and check
neighborhood_overview: Cotes des Neiges area is a student area, hot and busy in Montreal. Bank, restaurant, supermarket, grocery, pharmacy .. less than 5 minutes.  20 min direct with the bus to downtow Perfect for students of UDEM, HEC or Polytechnique because schools are within 12 minutes walk. Distance in public transportation: Old Port= 30min Downtown= 20 min Jean talon = 15 min Parc jean Drapeau = 50 min (25 min by car, taxis or UBER)
transit: Several bus and metro are available: - 161 which can drop you to  plamondon or rosemont station - 165-435 to the downtown  Guy Concordia station 20 min - 370 night bus - Metro Blue Cotes des Neiges ( bleu line) walk 8 min - Plamondon orange line metro 8 min walk or 4 minutes by bus
access: You will have access to the whole apartment The apartment is fully equipped to make you feel at home: - Free parking in the street - Fully equipped kitchen (complete dishes, refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster) - 3 Bedrooms closed and fully furnished (linens provided, two double bed and 1 queen bed) - There is no living room - Bathroom with bathtub - Pay Laundry in the building ($ 1.50) - Smoking not allowed (only on balcony) - Pets not allowed - Internet unlimited Wi-Fi Everything is at your disposal so you have a pleasant stay!
interaction: The check in is at 4pm and check out is at 11 am but we are flexible.  Email communication only
house_rules: 1-Pas de bruit après 22h 2-Pas de fêtes. (immeuble résidentiel) 3-Toutes odeurs de fumée sera pénalisée d'un montant de 200$  retiré de la caution 4- Si les invités ne sont pas prêt à 11h pour le check out et que la femme de ménage est retardée dans son travail, un montant forfaitaire de 50$ sera retiré de la caution

host.host_about: Jeune Homme de confiance, attachant de l'importance a la qualité des services proposés.

reviews.comments: The place is as you can see in the pictures
This place is spacious and comfortable, we enjoyed our stay. Parking is a bit tricky, just watch out for the street signs to avoid a ticket.
The location was good and it was spacious.
Nice flat that is close to transport to get into the centre of Montreal in 20 mins. Good value for money.

This place is very homey however when I arrived the beds were not made but when I contacted the host he was very nice and the place was ready within a half hour
Would definitely recommend

Cedric's place is pretty good, the rooms are nice, and we got everything we need for our a home away from home. However, the floor sounds a bit when walking but it is not a big deal. overall, this is  good place to stay, will book a gain if I come to Montreal next time.
It was a great place for a few of us girls exploring Montreal for the weekend. It was homey and had a nice kitchen for cooking. It's close to buses as well. We'd definitely stay there again.

Cédric and Christina's place had a lot of space for three of us, as well as a balcony where we could spend some time in the evening. Unfortunately, and for the first time at all, we had a really bad experience staying at the apartment. We were unable to use the front door key from the outside and found it thus impossible to leave the place. The communication with the hosts was nearly impossible for the whole time, 20 hours later they also rejected to come by because no-one had been available. Fortunately Airbnb helped us out with the case and we were able to leave, find another place to stay and still enjoy the couple of days in Montreal. Me and my friends would not recommend staying at Cédric's place.
I suppose ‘old’ and ‘in process of repair’ is the charm of Montreal in general. This apartment certainly fills that description.

We had a terrible experience here. First ever after 7 air bnb stays. The place was so dirty that we managed to get a refund through Airbnb support. 
Some of the furniture was so old it wasn’t useable anymore. This is a run down dorm room, not a nice place to stay. 
Host had strict refund policy ( of course ) but she did refund us. She charged us cleaning fees though, which was very ironic!

Nice apartment with only a couple flights of stairs, we were very comfortable and had no complaints. Very nice and quiet neighbourhood with a balcony on the back. I would recommend this place to anyone willing to walk a few minutes to a subway.

name: DOWNTOWN/PLATEAU-SLEEPS 4-AMAZING LOCATION-QUIET!
summary: Top Montreal location! This quiet 1 BR. flat has a large living space with full kitchen/bath. Great view of boul St-Laurent aka "the Main" in the heart of the trendy Plateau district. Private parking available (additional fee). Walk or Bixi-bike to our festivals, restaurants, cafes, terraces, nearby Parc Mount-Royal, Mcgill, UQAM & Old Montreal. Sans aucun doute le meilleur endroit à Montréal!  Accommodates max 4 (double bed, sofa bed).
space: This flat is in a top location on Duluth near the bustling St-Laurent "Main". Walk to some of Montreal's best restaurants, head up the mountain on your Bixi bike, or enjoy shopping with everything you need steps away. The cozy living area has a sofa bed/lounge chair that converts into a double bed. The large bedroom is extremely quiet, as it faces the back terrace. There is a large AC unit that keeps the apt. nice and fresh during those hot summer days. Circulating fans are located in both rooms. A comfortable bed and plenty of storage. Hair dryer and iron are also available and staff on hand 24/7 to assist you.
description: Top Montreal location! This quiet 1 BR. flat has a large living space with full kitchen/bath. Great view of boul St-Laurent aka "the Main" in the heart of the trendy Plateau district. Private parking available (additional fee). Walk or Bixi-bike to our festivals, restaurants, cafes, terraces, nearby Parc Mount-Royal, Mcgill, UQAM & Old Montreal. Sans aucun doute le meilleur endroit à Montréal!  Accommodates max 4 (double bed, sofa bed). This flat is in a top location on Duluth near the bustling St-Laurent "Main". Walk to some of Montreal's best restaurants, head up the mountain on your Bixi bike, or enjoy shopping with everything you need steps away. The cozy living area has a sofa bed/lounge chair that converts into a double bed. The large bedroom is extremely quiet, as it faces the back terrace. There is a large AC unit that keeps the apt. nice and fresh during those hot summer days. Circulating fans are located in both rooms. A comfortable bed and plenty of storage. Hair dryer and i
neighborhood_overview: The Plateau is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Many diverse restaurants from all cultures imaginable. Lots of choices for vegans as well. For meat-lovers, the best steak houses & smoked meat delis are literally steps away. Coffee? Only the best in Montreal...and right downstairs! Looking for culture..there are many events always happening in the area. Walk to the famous "Tam Tam" at Mount-Royal park on a summer Sunday. Enjoy people watching on local terrace while sipping that drink. festivals like Nuits d'Afrique, the Fringe Festival and the Montreal Mural Festival are steps away. Shopping? The area houses many exclusive boutiques offering local designers. Many different thrift stores in the area...Walk into "Kitsch'n Swell" one of the most unique and beautiful shops just up Saint-Laurent, or head over to nearby St-Denis and avenue Mont-Royal for even more selection. Rent a Bixi bike or head up the mountain for a picturesque view of the city. Le Plateau Mont-Royal est un quartier plein
notes: The kitchen table can sit 2 at a time comfortably. The table can be moved to the living area to allow for more guests to sit. Extra chairs are available upon request. This unit is at the top of a long flight of stairs, so be sure to arrange your arrival time ahead for us to greet you with keys, we are happy to assist you with your luggage until 10pm at which time other arrangements can be made. We also have a lockbox for overnight arrivals. Please keep blinds closed to keep the place cool in summer, and conserve hydro where possible, shutting things down when you go out. Absolutely no smoking. An ashtray is on the back balcony for this purpose, please keep all doors closed. The sofabed has legs that fold down along with the bed, located in the back. Be sure these are fully extended when you have the sofabed out, and that a mattress pad is used along with your essential guest bedding. Check-out is 11am and check-in after 4pm. Sometimes this can be flex, just ask :) Luggage storage is al
transit: Public transit is always recommended in the downtown core, and in the Plateau, it is densely populated with many one way, Euro-style narrow streets. Most of the time, you should find a spot street parking, nearby. Watch signage carefully, and avoid signs with red squares, which means you must be a resident with a permit / sticker in your window for that zone. Instead, look for zones with days of the week (DLMMJVS). Many drivers leave their cars and use public transit or BIXI Bikes. Private parking when available can be arranged in advance at a fee of about $25 / $30 per day. The bus station is at Berri/UQAM, with the exception of Megabus which is on St-Antoine closer to Bonaventure station (home to VIA Rail and Amtrak). Both are on the orange line, and BERRI/UQAM is a major artery for three lines, and is not far at all from your flat if you have the Shuttle drop you off their last as an option (keep in mind the shuttle makes stops at some hotels). The 55 St-Laurent bus goes to Place de
access: Full access to apartment. There is a multi-balcony/terrace area shared with the neighbours, accessible in the hallway just outside of the apartment, with folding chairs for you to enjoy that morning coffee or sunset drink.
interaction: We try to keep communication instant, direct and transparent and use the Airbnb thread along with our smartphones. Upon arrival, a text or phone call is required to reach us. Guests have free reign over the flat and full privacy, but don't hesitate to send questions or needs to your host. We are there to ensure you have a great stay! I am around in case you need anything. Reachable 24/7. Feel free to communicate in English, French, Spanish & Hungarian.  On peut me joindre 24h sur 24. Je parle anglais, français, espagnol et hongrois.
house_rules: ------  HOUSE RULES  ------ 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $250 or more. Security deposits aren’t collected automatically. A host uses the Resolution Center to upload documentation of the damages (like photos or receipts), and request money from their guest to fix those damages.  2. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You are welcome to request an early check in or late check out, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance.  3. We do not allow smoking and pets; breaking this rule will incur a $250 fine.  4. Parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations.  5. If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $40 for every extra hour per housekeeper of cleaning required.  6. Guests are not allowed to book a stay in their city of residence.  7. Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By

host.host_about: Love Montreal. I know the city well. You will be guided to the best sites and fall in love with my city! I have travelled to many destinations in my lifetime and one of my true passions is meeting new people from all parts of the world. My promise to you is that I will be a fabulous host & that your visit to Montreal will be most memorable.

reviews.comments: Located in a very hip neighborhood. Not really suitable for families because there are clubs near the area. Host was nice and accommodating. Would recommend.
Steve est une personne bienveillante et chaleureuse qui s'est très bien occupée de nous à notre arrivée. Le quartier est fantastique !
Super appartement, très propre et fonctionnel.
Steve's place is very centrally located, comfortable, nice and clean. Steve and David are great hosts. Will come back to their place whenever we travel back to Montreal. Thank you, Steve and Dave!

Great location right in the heart of the action (loud at night but it's the city!); walking distance to everything, nice host(s) who had good suggestions to eat in the area, no frills but has your basic needs.
Host very helpful. Can be contacted if this property is booked as he has others. Nice clean apartment
Spacious place in a cool location for a great price. Walked to many of the popular sites.

The stay was great! He did pop up a few times which was unexpected. Also there was a wifi appointment during my stay which was a little inconvenient. But he is very laid back and nice. Other than that location is awesome ! I would recommend.
Steve est un très bon hôte, il est très accueillant, il nous a très bien conseillé sur les choses à faire, les restaurants et les bars. Je conseille ce logement qui est très bien situé.

This apartment is in a great neighbourhood! We loved the location and access to great restaurants and cafes! The apartment is quiet, clean and minimalist. Suited us very well. Steve is a wonderful host. He offered great suggestions nearby and was very easy to communicate with. 
We would definitely choose to stay here again!

el departamento está muy bien ubicado. El bario es relindo!!!!
Nosotros éramos dos que queríamos tener un poco de independencia cada una y eso anduvo requetebien
Usamos el living como un segundo dormitorio y la cocina como living!!!!

Todo funcionaba bien y no fue necesario acudir a Steve en ningún momento.
Volvería y lo recomiendo

El departamento es muy lindo, la cocina cómoda para cocinar y comer ahí. 
Había cafe azucar tuppers papel film. 
La calefacción es central, por lo que no se puede prender cuando uno quiere. 
Ideal la ubicación, no hay mejor!!
Parfait à tous les niveaux ! Recommandé

Steves Apartment #8 at 2nd floor was perfect for my baby daughter, husband and me for our 5 night stay in Montreal. Just in front of the door the 55 bus is stopping which is perfect to get around. Also the area itself the plateau mont royal is very hip and trendy. You can reach grocery stores, liquor stores, bars, Schwartz, restaurants and cafes very easy by walk less than 5 minutes. Steve is very helpful and gives his best for a comfortable stay. The apartment itself is very basic but is well equipped. We would recommend to stay here and also would come again.
Comfortable apartment with the ideal location for having fun in Montreal.  Everything you will need is within a 15-minute walk.  Steve is responsive to any questions and knows Montreal well.

Location Location, Location! You are in the hip part of the Plateau Mont Royal. Everything you need is less than a block away: greta restaurants, a fantastic grocery store with a lot of international food and vegan options, an ice cream place, a great crepe place. Don't miss the Jerk store, just next door to the apartment. Steve's place has really fast internet, but the coffee shop downstair has the best coffee, so it quickly became my office :). Oh, important detail, Steve has a really nice A/C unit in the bedroom. The place was really clean. Steve helped me get a parking spot on the next block, so I didn't have to deal with parking my car in the street. And he showed me the cool spot in the neighborhood!

We had a great stay at Steve’s place. Location was perfect and quiet. AC was much appreciated during warm days and nights. Apt was spacious and clean. Communication with Steve was easy and fast. I would definitely stay there again.

We liked the location. Steve was super responsive and overall a great host. There was an electricity breakdown at 11pm on the night of our check-in, and he sent someone to fix it. He also provided a parking space next door for an  additional fee. The bathroom was supplied with toiletries: soap, shampoo, body gels, toilet paper. 

If you are *allergic* to pets fur, this might be important to you: we found some on furniture legs in the 2nd bedroom. We spent most of the time outside exploring Montreal and it only caused reaction when we were playing on the floor with a kid, but still it isn’t something I would expect from an apartment where pets aren’t allowed. 

I hope the points above are easy to fix and recommend Steve as a great host to anyone who wants to spend some quality time in Montreal.

We had a really good stay in Steve's place. The location is top notch, the apartment is quiet and has everything you need. Steve is a great host - easy to work with, responsive and very accommodating.

Solid place to stay and close to all the action, but not so close that you deal with all the riffraff. Steve is an excellent communicator, he’s very responsive and helpful. Had a minor issue with the air con not working, but he had someone with 10 minutes to come fix it (was a settings issue, not mechanical malfunction). Thanks again, Steve!

3rd floor apartment, great location. Good restaurants, coffee shops & bakeries nearby. Hard wood floors, no carpet...a plus in my book. Owner very responsive. Parking is available but somewhat expensive $20 CAD/night. We were there during a very hot spell & electricity went out in apartment at 1 AM. No electricity meant no AC. I messaged Steve & he responded immediately with a call to me. He determined what needed to be done. Electricity was restored by noon the next day.

This place is right in the heart of a charming neighborhood that has real character—lots of small restaurants and bars and sandwiched between two amazing parks. Coffee on the deck in the morning was relaxing. The apartment makes you feel like you’re a regular native.
Steve est un excellent hôte, réactif et arrangeant! L’appartement est très bien situé entre Plateau et Mont-Royal,  je recommande

name: COMFORTABLE APARTMENT IN TAKSIM
summary: Our apartment is located in the heart of Istanbul, only a couple of minutes’ walk away from the Taksim Square and Istiklal Avenue where there are many cafés, bars and restaurants with international and Turkish cuisine within walking distance. Taksim is also great with its night life so it is easy to come back home late. The apartment accommodates 2 people. The flat has a double bedroom and a salon where occasionally a guess can also stay. They are fully furnished with a desk, a big wardrobe, a sinfonier closet and a shoe closet, a comfortable sofa, a dining table and a small table. The kitchen is well equipped with new appliances: a washing machine, a refrigerator, an oven, a toaster all the ménage necessary for cooking. There is a natural gas combi heating system for heating and hot water. Wireless internet access and a projector. For history lovers the historical Sultanahmet area is 4 kilometres away. Near the house there is a transportation hub for metro, bus, airport buses and mini

host.host_about: Musician-Percussionist

reviews.comments: Thank you Hakan for your warm welcome! Sorry about the delay in writing a review. Nice flat within easy reach of the High Street. The lounge is great, comfortable bed. See you soon!

This unit is realy comfortable for 2 person,
Clean and cozy with good video projection.

Near to istiklal street, and hakan is a kind host and helpfull.
The reservation was canceled 16 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Hakan was a wonderful host, and went out of his way to make sure I was having a pleasant time in his apartment. The apartment itself was very comfortable and I loved the original brick and wood floors.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Hakan was a wonderful and very caring host with good tips for restaurants and cafes around. He picked us up and brought us to the apartement. It is exactly as shown in the pictures and we felt very comfortable. Around the corner there is a little shop where we found everything for breakfast or cooking. 
We really liked our stay in Istanbul and we can only recommend Hakan and his apartement to everyone. Thank you very much!

the flat is nicely located near the trendy area, nothing fancy but clean,
Hakan was a perfect host, came to pick me up at the bus station and was here in case I needed anything

My partner and I stayed at Hakan's apartment for 1 week and we loved it.  The apartment was very spacious and Hakan went out of his way on several occasions to show us around Istanbul.  His advice and assistance throughout our trip was great.  The location was very central.  We highly recommend this place.  Thanks Hakan!

My girlfriend and me stayed at Hakan's place for 6 days / 5 nights. The appartment is perfectly located nearby Istikal street and Taksim.  We had a great time staying in the appartment.  Hakan is a very friendly host and showed us some great places to eat and visit.  We can highly recommend this place.

Our host Hakan was great, for a start he picked us up from Taxim station at the middle of the night, then he kept in touch with us during all of our stay and finally had lunch with us on the last day :)
The place was clean, spacious and comfortable, and really felt like home.
The WiFi worked fine, there was very nice hot water in the shower and a small but well accessorized kitchen.
The neighborhood was not very interesting, but it was really very close to the Istiklal. (Website hidden by Airbnb)

Hakan's apartment was comfy and extremely central. He wasn't in town on the day we arrived, but arranged for his friend to pick us up from taksim and show us the way to the apartment. We were also fortunate to have the opportunity to listen to Hakan and his band play turkish and balkan gypsy music at a bar!

Hakan was a very welcoming host! The apartment is ideally located; not at all far from Istiklal Road and public transport too. I guess the location can't really be beaten... especially because of the view when walking back there at night!

Upon our arrival he picked us up, showed us how to get to the apartment and also showed us excellent places to eat. The apartment is clean and close to everything necessary in Istanbul plus he is great fun to hangout with and an excellent musician.

Hakan was a good host and there was no problem to communicate with him. He even checked if a taxi driver was cheating the way to his place which was so kind.
The location of his apartment was just great, to reach Istiklal for just minutes.
BUT, I think I should be honest about his apartment for his next guests.
It was understandable that there was a boiler issue on first day and was no electricity on second day because these were not his fault. What we were really uncomfortable was smell. There were smells from rotton wood, bathroom, and especially old matress... 
There were small broken things but I am sure Hakan will change them right soon. You should know that this is an old apartment anyway. It surely needs some repaires.
If it will be a little renovated, his apartment can be the one recommended.

This apartment was perfect for my month-long stay in Istanbul! It is spacious and well-located, with a corner store full of produce at the end of the street and central city hotspots just a short walk or tram ride away.

Hakan is an angel disguised as an incredible drummer. He was extremely responsive to my questions and concerns throughout my stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Hakan was really nice and responsive before my arrival. He picked me up in the centre when I arrived in Istanbul. The flat has everything one might need and everything worked as it should have been.  The flat is situated 10 minutes walk from Istiklal so one can get to the main sight conveniently to the main sight in Istanbul. I really enjoyed my stay at Hakan`s place and I woul recommend him and his flat everyone who would like to have a nice time in Istanbul.
Great apartment and hospitality. Thank you Hakan. Definitely staying again!

Good comfortable appartment on the second floor of an old building. The brother of Hakan showed us the house, wich is right on the corner of Euro Plaza Hotel. There was a problem with the boiler wich costs us a morning, but Hakans response was quick and he fixed it. The price is totally ok in comparisson to what you get, so I recommend it, but be sure to check the boiler when you enter.

My review for you will be.. Excellent Apartment and location. Most important is a wonderful caring Host that is Hakan. Overall a good value. I will try to stay there again if I return to Istanbul.
 
Teşekkürle Hakan.

Hakan é un musicista e persona squisita. Il giorno del mio arrivo aveva un concerto, mi ha mandato un amico, puntualissimo. Il giorno successivo è venuto a far conoscenza e vedere se ce ne fossero. L'appartamento é molto caldo (era un gelido dicembre) in ogni senso, non ha l'anonimità di appartamenti appena ristrutturati per essere affittati. E' molto vicino ad Istikal, é ben servito dai mezzi, ha negozi di quartiere tipicamente Istambulioti. Ottimo wifi e cucina molto attrezzata.

Hakan is a great host. Unfortunatly he was out when I came but he did everything for my smooth check-in.
Flat is spacious and had all essential things. Right next to the flat there are several shops that is really convenient.
Area is a bit shabby (common in Istanbul) but safe and sound for coming back alone at night.
Hope to stay there again.

Lovely stay at Hakan's flat, great host, very accommodating and helpfull. Small, simple flat in a residential street, great way to get a feel of Istanbul outside the touristic areas, I felt quite safe even at night. Istiklal street and Taksim square a few minutes walk away, lots of restaurants and shops nearby.
Overall a fantastic stay, would do it again!
D.

Place absolutety amazing place I've spend 8 nights and what I was looking for. Felt like home. The flat is cosy, with big beautful windows and cute balcony for morning coffee! Downstars you have small and cute street with everything you need: grocery with fresh fruits and vegetables, bakery (the best ever) and even small wine shop. 5 mins away from the biggest shopping street and all small streets with pubs and cafes (Taksim area). Perfect place to stay in Istanbul, quiet. Highly recommended.

I decided to book an apartment for my two-weeks-stay in Istanbul, which seemed a better alternative to staying at a hotel or hostel. I initially chose this place because of the good location, reasonable price, and altogether excellent reviews. The location is indeed good, but everything from the first communications to checkout was extremely disappointing. For the checkin, the host told me I would meet one of his friends in Taksim. When I got there, I waited over half an hour, trying to reach the friend, until I called the host. He then told me to come straight to the apartment (rather than waiting for the friend at Taksim), which was another fifteen-minute walk away. I should mention that I've traveled to Istanbul before so I'm familiar with the area, but juggling my luggage and trying to find a route on my phone was quite a hassle. When I arrived, the host was brusque, unfriendly, and did not give me a chance to even survey the apartment. I would go on to discover that almost everything in the apartment was broken and covered in a noticeable layer of grime. The toilet cover was gone and the water wouldn't stop until I reached my hand in the back tank and pulled a lever; the pole holding up the shower head was snapped off; the kitchen sink effectively had two settings--steady drip and explosive deluge; the handles on the cupboards were broken; part of the floor was taped over; one of the stove tops was broken; and the washing machine door wouldn't close. Then there was the cleanliness issue: both the kitchen and bathroom sinks were constantly swarming with small flies, the shower was still covered in the last guest's hair, the utensils and other cooking materials were encrusted with old food, and the floor was coated in grime. I was barely able to stomach scrubbing and boiling the bare utensils I would need to survive, and I ate out as much as was feasible. The apartment also lacked toilet paper when I first arrived. The host did bring some over, but only a day after I contacted him about it. After a day or so of living there, I noticed that periodically a strong smell of sewage would permeate the entire room. Windows closed or opened, it was unavoidable. The host said he'd never had complaints of a bad smell before, but for me at least, it was impossible to miss. One day, the water was shut off--this was likely an issue for the entire neighborhood, but it's never happened to me during prior trips to Istanbul. Though it didn't bother me, potential guests should also be aware that you can hear EVERYTHING the people upstairs do. I seriously considered leaving the apartment early and finding another place to stay, but unfortunately this was not financially feasible. Lastly, I contacted the host more than 24 hours before I planned to move out to arrange where to leave the key and what...

Tres bon rapport confort/situation/prix pour Istanbul. Comme dans beaucoup d'endroits ( j'en ai testé pas mal à istanbul ), il ne faut pas craindre le bruit des voisins ou prevoir de bonnes boules quies.
Acceuil sympathique.

Hakan is amazing host! He went to wait us at the metro station (not common at all) in Taksim Square, he showed us the flat and he was very helpful all along our stay in Istanbul. I recommend Hakan as he is a perfect Airbnb host.
All was good. I recommend to everyone who wants to live near Taxim.
Thanks

The apartment is conveniently located a close walking distance to Taksim. It was simple and clean but there was an unpleasant smell of sewage coming from the kitchen. The place did not have soap or shampoo as promised and was missing a shower curtain so the shower sprayed water all over the bathroom, which was very inconvenient. Host took several days to respond to messages and did not help resolve these issues. The place is generally fine but the host seemed not to be ready to deal with guests.
Hakan is very Nice, we had a great Time in this flat. It' s à Nice emplacement,the district is fun.

Overall a great place for the value. Close to shops, restaurants, and Istiklal street. It is a good 25 minute (with luggage) walk from either the Metro or where the Havabus shuttle drops you off. The flat also lacks A/C (I got used to it and the fan was invaluable) and it is about a three floor walk up, no television either, though you’ll be out exploring! The area is more residential, quiet and comfortable. The laundry is great to have and the space is quite large. The kitchen is adequate, I only cooked breakfasts there. A local doner shop is a MUST: Durumzade. (The Ulfa kabob platter is excellent.) Also try local Turkish wine and beer, good stuff! Once you purchase an Istanbulkart, the metro is easy and great for getting to all the top sights. (Highly recommend since Sultanahmet, Grand Bazaar, etc. is a good 45 minute walk, at least.) The cruise of the Bosphorus Straight is also a MUST. Only 24 lira and it was the highlight of my trip. The flat great space away from the hustle and bustle.

We enjoyed our stay in Hakans place. The apartment was clean and had everything we needed for a week stay. There are two rooms:one bedroom and a really big studio living room with couch, kitchen, and several tables to eat and to work. A gentle touch of old Istanbul houses was lovely. WiFi was good. Hot water was always there also. All the necessary dishes/bath towels/iron/hair dryer were there. The flat is situated on a calm street but still 5-7 mins walking to Istiklal street. Hakan was a nice host always online  and ready to help. Gladly will recommend his place.
Lovely Host Hakan and spacious flat. Area is close to Taksim but still residential and off from tourists. Enjoyed my stay here!

First, Hakan is a very nice and responsive host. The flat is spacious, with good light and very close to the Istiklal, while lying in a residential area. 
The stay was ok for us as we were always outside to visit this beautiful city!
However, one should not be picky about cleanness while staying in the apartment (the toilet smelled strongly of sewage, the shower doesn´t drain well, the towels were moldy etc.). 
So it was overall ok but could have been better ;)
L'appartamento è molto comodo e la posizione è perfetta per muoversi comodamente nel cuore della città. Hakan è preciso e disponibile.
Ok place but great location. recommend for budget travellers

AMAZING host. absolutely wonderful stay. we were left alone to do as we please and with everything so close to the flat it's a total no brainer to choose this place. 24/7 grocery store 50yards away from the flat means you're never low on snacks. and a further 20 yards to the right there's a turkish delight shop and barbers and coffee shop to make you feel local. (The local shops are WAY cheaper than the chic OTT touristy ones anyway with Same value)
will be staying again absolutely no doubt!
A central,comfortable apartament for a great price.

Hakan is a polite man.
His flat is charming and situated very close to Taksim,  Little Supermarket (7/24), bakery, Tekel, busstop, Little Restaurants and a lot of nice Pubs.

Pros 
Location close to amenities and away from hustle and bustle/traffic
Price/value for money
Flexible check in
Lots of space- good for couple
Balcony
Gas stove (yay!)

Cons
Thin walls and noisy neighbours
Shower doesn’t drain well (foot spa)

house_rules: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Saving Electricity: - Turn off your air-conditioner when you leave the house; - Turn off the common room air-conditioner (if you turned it on or are the last to leave the area) - Turn off lights/appliances once done using them (i.e. your bedroom lights, shower water heater, etc); - Use the washing machine for medium and large loads ONLY (single or few item washes can be done faster by hand and are highly wasteful in terms of energy and water). Bathroom Etiquette: - If you shower and find water on the bathroom floor, please kindly mop it up and leave the ventilation fan on (safety > incremental electricity cost); - Don’t forget to turn off the water heater after showering; - Keep the bathroom door closed at all times; - Flush after every use (preferably with toilet seat down). Humidity Management (April to October) - Do not leave windows open for extended periods of time and close all windows if you are the last to leave a room. - Turn on the Dehumidifier if the A/C
