reviews.comments: Perfect for my stay in Hong Kong. The apartment is big and clean. Close to everything and within 10 steps to subway! Host also makes sure I have everything I need during my stay and communicates with me well. I highly recommend this apartment with a superb location and will stay here again.
最喜欢他家的洗手间,有足够大的空间洗澡!还有干净的开放式厨房,挺不错!不过床的舒适度有待提高,临街的房子噪音也会有点明显,其他都可以,离弥敦道很近!

A wonderful place to stay and Anita is a great host, we got immediate response to our queries, though we didn't get to meet him. Anita has a beautiful layout for assisting his guests in commutation and check-in by guiding us using pictures which are very helpful. The place is 100% true as stated and ideal for long stay for families, group of frens etc., The view is dazzling and all amenities are available. The Aircon worked perfectly, bath tub is classic. Washing machine with dryer is good. Beds & linen were new and soft, water heater worked fine, WiFi was strong & fast, TV had soccer (football) channels (which I loved <3) and the kitchen is compact. Had a comfortable time. I would definitely recommend this apartment and love to come back next time in HK.

Very thankful for Anita's responsiveness during our stay. Everything was exactly as stated and the location was very central to our purpose for this trip but most importantly offered a very local experience in terms of food and shopping. Will look forward to stay there again.

Very nice, clean and quiet, you can see the beautiful night scene,It makes me feel good before going to bed every day.
The landlord couple is humorous and considerate.

I was surprised by how spacious the apartment is. Living room area is very large (although sparingly furnished) and the bathroom is also quite spacious. We really enjoyed our stay here. Everything was better than I expected.
Everything is wonderful. Great !!
Nice place for family, close to MTR.很适合家庭居住,交通便利｡
This studio is spacious and easy to find. My group of 4 ppl had a good time at this place.  Will come again, thank host!

최고의 숙소였습니다.
아주 깔끔하고 넓고 모든 것이 잘 준비되어 있었습니다.
관광하기에 위치도 적절하고 가격이 저렴해서 적극 추천합니다.

Anita’s place was very spacious and clean. It was close to two subway stations and many buses. The nightlife is amazing and the shops are closed late so you can definitely get a bite to eat if your hungry at night! We would definitely come back again!

The place was very easy to find especially if you’re coming from the airport and traveling via MTR. The subway was just in front of the building making it very accessible even when it’s raining. The amenities are all in good condition and it is clean & well organized as we checked-in. The security personnel from the lobby was very friendly and very helpful. We loved the view from the wide windows facing the park. We didn’t get the chance to meet the host since we checked-in around 10pm but I’m sure she is very nice and accommodating.

name: 1 block away from the beach
summary: Perfect for anyone wanting to exeprience Coney Island up close. 1 block away from the beach. 5 min walk to all major attractions and 8 min walk subway station.
space: Please keep in mind, cats and a toddler share the bathroom as well.  Also if you leave your room door open the cats will go inside and they may shed some fur so if you do not want that then keep your door closed.

reviews.comments:
Olga was a very pleasant host.
Her place is a block away from the beach and you can see the ocean from the window. I would stay there again
The place is clean and comfortable.
Excellent communication and very hospitable family! Earplugs were helpful as it was noisy in the area around bedtime.
Suitable if you just need to sleep

Olga is such a great host! She’s very kind and caring and knows the area very well and was able to help me get around even in Manhattan. The location is walking distance to the boardwalk and the beach.
Fun place next to the beach!
Olga is a sweetheart and takes the time to get to know what youre looking to do so you can enjoy your trip to the fullest.
The apartment has a great location and Olga was very kind and always willing to help
Nice spot close to the beach and boardwalk!
Good spot if you’re going to be spending the night, but not for a long duration. Olga was accommodating and welcomed me and my friend.

The room is on the 16th floor and has an amazing view. The ocean, the moon: breathtakingly pretty. The place is very neat and clean and Olga is very accommodating. She was very flexible with my time of arrival as I had to arrive a little later than planned. I needed a help with a few things and Olga made me feel very welcome and helped with everything. I had some wet clothing from the rain and I was able to use the dryer to dry my clothing. The bathroom is neat and it was really nice to take a nice hot shower after traveling in the rain in NYC. I was very comfortable sleeping on the mattress, with a fresh air from the ocean coming in through the window. Really great experience!

Olga is an amazing host very helpful, easy check in, she makes me feel like home, the building is located in a great place.. near the sea, and 13/14 minutes by walk from Coney Island luna park and subway, unfortunately poor cleaning make me feel not comfortable..
Very friendly host, great location

Olga is a great host.  This was my first air bnb.  I'm worried that future hosts wont measure up.  I will always try to stay here first when I'm on long island. Made me and my daughter feel like family.
Ольга очень гостеприимна! Мне безумно понравилось и совсем не хотелось уезжать. Excellent!!

reviews.comments:
Appartement propre, exactement comme sur les photos et même mieux, très propre et bien équipé, le logement de Sandrine et très bien entretenu, à proximité d'une rue animée de restaurants et d'épiceries, mais aussi d'une station de métro facile d'accès ou d'arrêts de bus. 
Notre séjour a été super, merci à Sandrine même si nous n'avons pas pu la rencontrer en personne, ses amis ont été super !

Wonderful apartment- clean, spacious, cozy, and amazing value. Great price for the place! The 2 patios were beautiful and the shower was 10/10. We were greeted in a friendly and welcoming manner which kicked off an amazing stay in Montreal. Would definitely recommend!

Superbe séjour chez Sandrine, l'appartement est superbe et d'une propreté (Website hidden by Airbnb) plus le quartier est calme et beaucoup de bon petits (Website hidden by Airbnb) recommande vivement !

Perfect little apartment to come home to after a day of sightseeing and activities. The balcony was absolutely great. A very cute “up and coming” neighborhood. Sandrine was very helpful with suggestions of local things to do and see.

name: Newly Renovated Brooklyn Apt.
summary: This newly renovated Brooklyn apartment is located off Franklin Ave. which is highly populated with great restaurants and bars. The bedroom is located on opposite side of the apartment from roommates. It features a full size bed, closet, and dresser. The living room, bathroom, and kitchen are shared spaces with a friendly couple in their mid 20s. No smoking. No drugs. Closest Trains: C, 2, 3, 4, and 5. About 45 minute subway commute to midtown manhattan.
space: Newly renovated in 2016. Bedroom has great light. Kitchen and bathroom are brand new. Nicky decorated living spaces.

reviews.comments: Es war eine gute Unterkunft. Man ist 30min von Manhatten entfernt. In der Nachbarschaft kann es schon einmal laut werden, doch für Junge Leute die Party machen wollen ist es gut.
Great host and great place. Super clean and amazing decor. Love the simple but elegant paintings. Friendly roommates who were willing to make my stay comfortable and fun. Highly recommend.

Small but cozy room. Neighbors are very friendly. Location is good. A few subway stations are in the walking distance. Prospect park and Brooklyn botanic garden are in the walking distance too. David was online and ready to help. I recommend this place.
Cozy spot in a great location

name: A Private Room for 4 People
summary: Hello! We are Meeting Point Hostels, a brand new youth hostel in Barcelona with friendly, relaxed and international atmosphere. Here you will find all necessary services and facilities to make your stay comfortable.
space: Our 4 private room is a great choice if you are looking for a quieter environment or if you come to Barcelona with a small group of friends. The room has 2 standard bunk beds (190cm long), ensuite bathroom and shower facilities. Each bed has a reading light, a small shelf and a power socket. To keep your personal belongings safe there are individual lockers with keycard locks at your disposal. Bed linen is included in the price and towels can be rented at a surcharge. Hairdryers are available at the front desk upon request. Please note that we do not serve breakfasts.

reviews.comments:
Murat is not just a great host --- he took his time showing me around the city, welcoming me to join him and his friends for drinks, offering help with every question i had, teaching me some Turkish, even cooking and serving home-made meals (!) and a lot more. But above everything, I really appreciate and value the friendship and respect he provided with me so genuinely and graciously that one cannot ask for more when traveling in a foreign city.

Murat's flat is cozy, clean and warm with lots of characters that feel a real-living, creative space. It's located right on the main bars/nightlife street in the lively (best!) neighborhood in Istanbul --- Kadıköy. Lots of friendly shops, restos, cafés and bars around, with the tram, ferry and metro all in short walking-distance. You get the cosmopolitan feel of the city here, but still within easy reach of all the major, historical tourist sites.

If you are a solo traveler or a couple who want to experience the real Istanbul life like a local even for a few days, don't even consider another place --- you will be lucky to stay at Murat's like I did !

name: Our COZY LOFT in Williamsburg, Brooklyn
summary: Our COZY LOFT in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. This is really quite a paradox in term. But it is what we have been told. We call it Vila Maria, and it reflects my wife's ancestry of Brazil, my own from Basel, Switzerland, and our eclectic lifestyle here in Brooklyn. NOTE, THIS IS THE HOME WE LIVE IN, and share with guests.  Be gentle, be kind, be respectful and clean. Then all will be fine, and we will have a ball, sharing stories and a good laugh now and then. And hopefully also a good glass wine.

host.host_about:
I was born and raised in Switzerland, into a family of watchmakers, engineers, doctors, architects, artists, musicians, and missionaries. Uncles, aunts and cousins doing God's work all over the world, people not principally interested in money. Not to say that I do not approve of wealth and power. My grandfather, after all, was a wealthy man, founding a watch company more than 100 years ago, but let your good fortune be applied for a good purpose. 

Religion, however, is too confusing for me to understand, so I stick to nature. This is my guide in life. And it has worked very well for me so far. For these reasons, science, culture, politics. social justice, economics and all the things that make this world go round are of great interest to me. I'm green politically, blue in many ways, my eyes, my jeans, my bathroom towels, my mood once in a while, blue is good, I feel fine. Red and black attracts me, but generally, I will try to keep a cool head. White is beautiful, but what or who is spotless? Yellow and orange are great, who does not like sunshine? But I prefer gold. And silver would be my blue. It suites me better. I'll tell you more at a later point. 

Blond originally, but most hair that remains on my body is in all other places than on my head. I shave off the rest, with some stubble remaining once in a while when I'm just too lazy. I am a mountain person, strong, agile, in good shape. Style? Always appropriate for the occasion. Quality is what matters. And who does not recognize that, oh well, simply does not recognize it.

If you want to stay in a typical loft in NYC/Brooklyn, this is a right place. The loft complies with the description and Stefan was very helpfull and discret. The loft is very well located, in Brooklyn, close to Bedford Av and Metropolitan Av. Very easy to reach NYC by subway (One stope from Bedford av) or bicycle. Just one thing...PERFECT.
This has been by far my favorite place I’ve stayed at while using Airbnb. Stefan’s home is beautiful and eccentric and he is a very warm and kind host. We loved every aspect of our stay here.
It’s perfectly located, really easy to get around both Brooklyn and Manhattan. I had a great stay with Stefan.

Stylish Brooklyn loft.  Great location a short walk from the L into Manhattan.  Clean and comfortable.  Stefan is very friendly, communicative, and knowledgeable.  I really enjoyed my stay and hope to visit again!

I spent a month at Stefan's place and it was one of the best AirBnB experiences I've had so far! The loft is absolutely amazing – cozy, creative and clean.  Located in the heart of wonderful Williamsburg with many bars, restaurants and shopping facilities around the corner and just a short walk to L train (Bedford Avenue station) and East River ferry (North Williamsburg stop). And last but not least: Stefan is a great, very obliging host, always in a good mood and up for a laugh. I can highly recommend this place!

In the last year and a half I have stayed in 20+ Airbnbs in NYC.  Stefan’s place is by far the best.  

On top of that Stefan is a wonderful host and a great person.

You can’t go wrong with this spot.  Enjoy!

I would thoroughly recommend this space to anyone wanting to explore Brooklyn/Manhattan. Stefan's place was fantastic. Convenient location, warm and clean space, and excellent amenities. Stefan was very obliging; his responses were very fast, and he made sure I had everything I needed. Thanks!

The loft is exactly as you see it: big, spacious, with style. Close to subway & ferry and you get to Manhattan in 20 minutes. 
Quiet, respectful & easy going, great comunication with Stefan.

name: Tootsie's Hideaway
summary: Secluded & charming, Tootsie's Hideaway is nestled on a hillside in upcountry Waimea (Kamuela, Big Island). Perfect for singles or couples, studio is accessible by outside stairway--private & independent from host's space.  Dining Nook, separate from bedroom, provides workspace, as well as a place to eat, while Lanai extends living area. Host's friendly outdoor cat may welcome you (not allowed to enter your indoor space).  Two people maximum in studio suite; no extra guests or pets allowed.
space: Enjoy a cup of tea or glass of wine in comfy outdoor chairs on your private Lanai, which serves as an outdoor living space, and provides morning sunshine and pink sunset clouds in the evening.  High-speed Internet makes it easy to stream movies or watch a show on your laptop in the Dining Nook (no TV in the Studio). Microwave, fridge, toaster and electric kettle are provided for simple meal prep (no stove or oven). French press & Melita cone filter & small coffee packet & tea provided, along with simple snacks to get started. The separate Bedroom allows one person to sleep in, while another makes coffee and checks email in the Dining Nook or on the Lanai. (Set up is like a hotel; no kitchen sink.) The en suite bathroom (shower, sink and toilet) and the ample queen-size bed provide comfortable sleeping. Open the windows and curtains to allow breeze and afternoon sun in, or close the thick curtains for sleeping in. Nearby beaches have BBQ grills & 3 weekly Farmers Markets & local restaur

neighborhood_overview: Upcountry Waimea (Kamuela on Hawaii Island, the Big Island) is cooler in temperature by about 10 degrees Fahrenheit, when compared to Kailua-Kona, where the airport (KOA) is located. The green grass and rolling hills with grazing cattle remind people of foothills, however from parts of the town, you can still see the ocean, as well as Mauna Kea. At 13,803 ft, Mauna Kea, almost a "fourteener," is draped in a cloak of snow at times in the winter.  It's a 3 minute drive from Tootsie's Hideaway to the coffee shop and other shopping, only two minutes more to the grocery store. The energetic can ask me directions for a low-traffic route to the coffee shop and unique gift stores, or to the Nature Park for a relaxing stroll.  Summer it is generally 70 - 85 degrees Fahrenheit (21 - 29 degrees Celsius). Winter varies from 55 - 70 degrees Fahrenheit (13 - 21 degrees Celsius). Please note: Sudden changes in temperature are common year-round, and the breeze can be chilly. Bring a jacket or wrap to
notes: Again, there are three sets of stairs and NO wheelchair access.  There is a bathroom sink, much like a hotel setup. I provide a small basin and dishwashing liquid and a dishtowel for washing up. There is a nearby laundromat. Guest laundry is available from me at $15 per load. (I will wash, dry & fold your laundry but may need at least 24 hours if I'm working. Please check with me.)
transit: Waimea is fairly central on the island. It takes just under an hour by car from  the airport (KOA) in Kailua-Kona to drive to Waimea. From Waimea it takes about 20 minutes by car to get to the beach and 30 minutes to reach Hawi on the northernmost tip of the island, and just over an hour to get to the historic town of Hilo.  It is best to rent a car at the airport in Kailua-Kona. Although there are some buses on the island, the time schedules cater to those working at the resorts.
access: To reach Tootsie's Hideaway from the street-level parking area, guests descend three outdoor stairways leading through the garden area to the ground level (no wheelchair access). Guests are welcome to enjoy the yard, rope swing and their private Lanai.  The Host's private space includes the middle floor and top floor of the property.
interaction: I communicate with Guests electronically during their stay so that we both have privacy. However, I'm happy to provide more information about our community and sight seeing. Suggestions include:   See whales on a Whale Watch boat tour, approximately November through May; Watch the molten lava spill into the ocean or hike out to the lava flow in Volcanoes National Park; Take a tour to the top of Mauna Kea to see the sunset or stargaze at the Observation Level; Drive down to Waipio Valley (all-wheel drive vehicle required) to see the wild horses and black sand beach; Schedule a helicopter tour to get a bird's-eye view of our island.
house_rules: - Space is appropriate for 2 people. A single Mom or a single Dad with a teen would be comfortable. - Quiet hours from 10 pm to 7 am. - Hawaiian custom: no shoes inside.

host.host_about:
I have lived on Hawaii Island (the Big Island) for 17 years & I love our small community. I enjoy meeting people from all over the world & have lived & traveled in Europe, South America & went to Japan this year. 

I enjoy helping people find the things they want to do & see in our community & on our island. I love having my finger on the pulse of what's happening & if I can't answer your question right away, I can find out the answer quickly! I love connecting people with other people & helping in whatever way I can. I enjoy people from diverse backgrounds with interesting stories to share.

I speak Italian & German (although they are a bit rusty!) & I lived in both Italy & Germany, so I understand the challenges of traveling in another country & do what I can to ease things. I also speak a small amount of Spanish & French (can read it better than I speak!). I'm currently trying to learn a bit of Japanese (just getting started!) & have also studied a bit of Farsi!

My favorite things are Partner Dancing (Social Dance), such as Ballroom, Salsa, Swing & Argentine Tango. I love traveling & hope to one day see the Taj Mahal, Istanbul, Bali, Tahiti, Cordoba, Grenada, Malta, Vietnam, Thailand... well... I love to travel! I enjoy good wine & fine chocolate. I love sunsets at the beach... sunset is my favorite time of day & I try to see it each day. Surprising fact? I like old cars. 

Airbnb asked me for my life motto: How about Namaste? The good in me sees the good in you.

reviews.comments: Marie's place was amazing! Nestled in a beautiful neighborhood, 15 mins walk from town. Marie was the best host ever! She was friendly, helpful, and grateful! The neighborhood is peaceful and Waimea is just amazing. I couldn't recommend Tootsie's Place more. Absolutely perfect!

The whole stay at Marie's Airbnb was really pefect from the beginning on. Already before arrival she provided detailed information for the directions to find her place. Appartement itself looked exactly like on the pictures. It was clean and one can see that it was furnished with care and love to details. The place is pefect for a couple. Also the surrounding of Waimea is very nice. You can reach stunning beaches within 20 mins. Airport of Kona is 1 hr away. Marie was very welcoming and really enjoying having guests even inviting us for a wine. We can recommend to stay with Marie on Big Island. Thanx again for everything.

This unit was clean, cozy, and a bargain for the Waimea neighborhood.  The host provided a bottle of wine, a small fruit basket, and some packaged snacks to get the weary traveler started off right.  There is also free wifi service with excellent reception.

Tootsie´s Hideway is the perfect homebase to explore this beautiful island. There is everything you need (Coffeemaker, Microwave (if you don´t want to go out for dinner), fridge, internet, cosy bed, towels.....
Waimea is a small beautiful city, it looks like you´re in the middle of the USA, but at the same time you are at the best beaches (like Hapuna Beach) in around 20 minutes. Waipio Valley is around 40 min, Kona 60 min, Hilo 75 min and Mauna Kea 90 min. 
And Marie is amazing.
Just go there!

Marie is one of the true Airbnb hosts who "gets" it. She gives you space but is readily accessible with tips and local lore. She clearly cares about your island experience (local fresh fruit and coffee!) and keeps her cozy place economically priced. Centrally located, cooler than the beaches and just as leafy as the rainforests, I highly recommend staying here.
Very comfortable space and well located.

This apartment is close to town and in a special  location in Waimea. 
One has total privacy being surrounded by tall shrubs and local trees.
If one is fortunate,one evening might be spent sharing  a glass of wine and good conversation with the owner.

My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Tootsie’s Hideaway! Marie is super responsive, the space was cozy, exceptionally clean and very comfortable. This was a great place to stay to enjoy Waimea and still be only 20 minutes from the beach.

Marie is a very thoughtful host, leaving us fresh fruit for the length of our stay to make mornings even sweeter. 

The apartment has a fantastic private porch/lanai that makes the space feel larger and extend your days from sunrise to sunset, even in the occasional Waimei rain.

Marie is an excellent host and fun person. Couldn’t ask for anything to have been better. The neighborhood is my favorite in Waimea! Perfect location. Everything was as advertised. I will no doubt book with her on my next trip to Waimea.

This cute hideaway provides privacy and a good location in a desirable neighborhood away from the busy main road in Waimea. It was perfect for my 7 day stay to catch up with friends/family and live like a local while being 15 mins from my favorite beaches. Marie provides an electric kettle for tea drinkers like me and all sorts of goodies to welcome you such as fresh fruit, wine and healthy snacks. There's a chopping board and knife so you can prepare fruit or salad or sandwiches and the toaster is handy so I had what I needed for breakfast and simple meals. The space was very comfortable for one and could work well for a couple for short stays. The comfy chairs on the large lanai make for an outside living room. Marie is a great host, giving you complete privacy but attentive if needed. Her instructions are clear and she's thought of everything.  You'll love the sound of the birds in the morning. Book this space if it's available!

Best Airbnb we have had in Hawai so far. Marie did'nt consider us as customers but friends and this is very nice specially when you come from Europe! She did everything to make our stay confortable and easy. She did even more bringing us is a show one evening.

My experience with the host was pleasant and very seamless. Marie was so easy to communicate with and left me some treats and even a bottle of wine....all the amenities and then some.  The exterior of the home was beautifully landscaped with pleasant smells and the quietness if the property was serene.  The neighborhood was beautiful and the people were very friendly.  Waimea was awesome and close enough to the beaches.

A perfect hideaway with the most wonderful hostess! This is a very private, quiet, peaceful, well organized and impeccably clean place to stay. We enjoyed the location in Waimea from which we could explore the north part of the island as well as enjoying the wonderful town itself.

Marie is a great host. When we arrived she had fresh yogurt and a bottle of wine for us. Lots of advice, great communicator and great directions to find her place. We loved the location. Not that far from restaurants and shops in Waimea. Just 20 minutes from Hapuna beach.

This was a great place to stay while exploring the big island! My wife and I stayed here two weeks, and enjoyed the whole time.

Nice and private location, it was quiet in the evenings, and whenever we needed her, Marie was quick to respond by text and then quick to act. The space was large enough for us to spread out comfortably, and the porch was a great place to hang out in the evenings or spend some lazy days. Would highly recommend!

True to description and pictures. Great value for price. Quiet, peaceful location. Marie communicates great. Pleasantly surprised how gorgeous upcountry Hawaii is, beautiful green rolling hills, Parker Ranch pastureland behind the housing development Marie lives in. Very nice to be up and away from the commercialism of the coast. Thanks for being a wonderful host Marie!!
Lovely, quiet, private space.  Very clean and comfortable with lots of thoughtful touches.
No better place to stay in Waimea, highly recommend!!

Marie’s Place was beautiful, quiet and private, a lovely place to stay for a few days in a beautiful Waimea area! There were lovely thoughtful touches throughout the studio (umbrella, torch, breakfast and fruit) and while we didn’t meet Marie she was so welcoming and helpful, providing a lot of local tips, to make our stay perfect. The lanai was a beautiful space to relax in the morning or after a day of exploring. Thanks again Marie and we’ll definitely stay again if we return to Waimea!

My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Tootsie's Hideaway. The accommodation was immaculate, comfortable, and peaceful - great to come back to at the end of the day to unwind. it had all the basics you need. Tootsie was really helpful with tips on where to go, prompt in her replies, and so friendly. Great range of food in town, cooler and more comfortable climate than down at sea level (yet a convenient drive to the beach), and beautiful scenic drives nearby.

Cozy apartment with a nice terrace in short driving distance to all local amenities. Marie is a great host who was responsive at all times, and gave us many helpful tips on things to do in & around Waimea. Thank you!
Great location. Very private and quiet!
Awesome place for exploring Big Island. Absolutely separated from the main house, has more than everything. Marie was so nice and helpful. We will definitely try to come back to this place one day.
Quiet lovely spot, perfect for a solo traveler or a couple.  Marie is very thoughtful, a perfect host.

Loved this space! Marie had absolutely everything you could think of wanting for a stay in Hawaii. The room was great, the yard fabulous and the swing a blast. Highly recommend a stay at this lovely abode
Pleasant and helpful host. Lovely private and quiet setting.

Host is very warm and welcoming.  Very clean room with nice homey touches provided by host. It is small and there are lots of stairs.  Automatic lights come on at night for climbing the stairs.   Had a nice stay.
Cheerful and personable host.  A great lanai to view sunsets from.  Be sure to bring wine.
The apartment was perfect! I really enjoyed having coffee on the lanei in the morning.  It's a great place to base yourself while you explore the north side of the island!

Marie's place in Waimea is centrally located near the town center and is a great place for a solo traveler like me or a couple. Marie has thought of every detail in her place that a person might need while traveling. Her place is snug, comfy and neat as a pin. In the afternoon the lanai is a lovely place to hang out, read and relax in the sun. We shared some wonderful conversations about our common interest in travel. I hope to return again on future visits.

Marie is such a kind and friendly host, you will really enjoy staying in her guest suite. The suite has a cosy bedroom, en-suite and small attached study area that serves as a kitchenette. The local town has plenty of food options so there's no real need to cook, but Marie was kind enough to leave out snacks and microwaveable food. The suite is on the lowest floor of a 3 story home and although it doesn't have a view, and is set into the hill, it does have a little patio to sit on and enjoy a morning coffee. 

The area is a great midway stop off if you're wanting to see a few spots up north and stay fairly central to them. We used it as a jumping off point to Hawi, Waipio, Mouna Kea and visiting a Vanilla farm. The town isn't huge but has some nice coffee and food spots. It's sometimes a bit rainy there, but that does mean we saw loads of rainbows, as sunshine is not far off.

Is Marie offers you a coffee on her Lanai - say yes! She has a lovely view, friendly cat, and it was she's so friendly it's easy to get lost in conversation and forget you have day plans! 

I would definitely recommend Marie's place as a nice spot to stay in and visit the nearby area.

Tootsie's Hideaway was one of the best, if not the best, Airbnb's I've stayed in.  The place is beautifully kept, Marie was an amazing host, and the value was par to none.  Marie's home is in a beautiful part of Waimea with easy access to most parts of the island.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone staying on the Big Island.  Thanks again Marie, for opening your home up to my wife and I.

Cute, small place, with lots of attention to detail by Marie.  Perfect for a single person or a couple but there would be no space for a third.  In a quiet neighborhood in Waimea, you are 15 minutes from Hapuna beach and 15 minutes from Honoka'a/20-25 minutes to Waipio.   Waimea is a great ranch town with good restaurants and a great farmers market.

The place is super efficient and clean with just about everything you need in a small space and nothing you don't (no tv, which wasn't missed).  We really enjoyed our stay!
A wonderful and peaceful place with nice personal touches throughout. Highly recommended
A perfect, quaint place for exploring the North of the island.

My fiance and I stayed at Marie's place for a week. The location was excellent, and an easy drive to all of the places we went. Checking in was easy and there were nice little touches including coffee and snacks, as well as all toiletries we would need. The place itself was clean and nicely decorated, the perfect space for two people. The lanai was excellent for a morning coffee. While we were in Hawaii, there was a storm that left us in our AirBnB most of one day, and Marie went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. She came down with a lantern, extra batteries, water bottles, and snacks in case the power went out and she even baked some cookies and brought us down a few. We loved our stay at Marie's and hope to one day come back!

name: Peaceful Refuge in Central Kona
summary: Enjoy yourself in this bright, airy and clean guest house with it's colorful island decor, beautiful garden surroundings, and peak-a-boo view of the ocean.    Located almost directly above the Honokohau Harbor at a cooler elevation of about 750 feet with sweeping ocean, sunset and mountain views! A large tiled patio above with a nearby waterfall and pond provides a lovely outdoor space to enjoy meals, sunning or watching for the green flash come sunset.
space: This one bedroom seperate guest house will give you privacy and space without leaving you isolated in some remote and inconvenient part of the island.  Plenty of windows allow light, airflow and views of the flowers, ocean and waterfall. The colorful decor features bamboo furnishings and some original island art.
description: Enjoy yourself in this bright, airy and clean guest house with it's colorful island decor, beautiful garden surroundings, and peak-a-boo view of the ocean.    Located almost directly above the Honokohau Harbor at a cooler elevation of about 750 feet with sweeping ocean, sunset and mountain views! A large tiled patio above with a nearby waterfall and pond provides a lovely outdoor space to enjoy meals, sunning or watching for the green flash come sunset. This one bedroom seperate guest house will give you privacy and space without leaving you isolated in some remote and inconvenient part of the island.  Plenty of windows allow light, airflow and views of the flowers, ocean and waterfall. The colorful decor features bamboo furnishings and some original island art. Guests can access back yard, spacious tiled deck (from sunrise to sunset), and laundry (for guests staying longer than 3 nights) during their stay. Carol has lived in Kona for twenty years and enjoys providing helpful informati
neighborhood_overview: This peaceful home is nestled in the Kona Harbor View neighborhood which is only a few minutes from every convenience, be it shopping, dining, schools, medical or recreational facilities, and has easy access to both the upper and lower highways.  You may find that the authenticity and peaceful pace of an established Kona neighborhood is a refreshing alternative to the more commercial and predictable condo life!
transit: A car is probably the best way to get the most out of being on the Big Island.  There is public transportation within walking distance but the schedule is fairly limited.  An Ironman with only a bike could probably manage but it is an uphill climb!
access: Guests can access back yard, spacious tiled deck (from sunrise to sunset), and laundry (for guests staying longer than 3 nights) during their stay.
interaction: Carol has lived in Kona for twenty years and enjoys providing helpful information, assistance and hospitality to her guests throughout their stay.
house_rules: - Quiet hours from 10pm to 8am. - Upstairs patio and deck area available for use from sunrise through sunset.

host.host_about: I'm a licensed realtor and have lived in Kona for more than 15 years.  I enjoy helping people get the most out of their time visiting the Big Island and having nice people to share my home with.  I love kids so they are always welcome as a second guest!

reviews.comments:
My stay at Peaceful Refuge was far beyond my expectations!!! Carol was more than nice and accommodating. I could not have asked for a better host/place. She was so helpful, and sweet during my time stay that I felt right at home from the very beginning. Whether it was helping me find things to do, to how to get around town, to even helping me find the best deals locally and showing me some epic spots. Her place was everything she promised and so much more. Beautiful ocean views from deck, best part of waking up. Great secluded backyard. Plenty of parking. 
Completely at peace and so comfortable that the only hard part was actually parting with her place! So glad I found this spot, definitely coming back. 
Thank you so, so much Carol!

Oke I stayed nearly 3 weeks in Carols place! Nice cool place to be! You need a car to drive around but the place is fabulous! Be aware it is not big but it has everything to make your kona stay very pleasant!! 

I did the IRONMAN completion and it is a good training going up.. but think for not trained people a little to much! Pals I road will lead you straight into Kona centrum! That is about 5km!

Your host Carol will tell you what is to do in kona and where to shop ! She even did some of my groceries during my stay when I was training! 
Thanks Carol I could not get a better place to stay during the Ironman event! 
Franck
Carol’s place is outstanding. She provided everything I need and I will back again and I will recommend Carol’s place to my friend who will visit big island.
Carol is very helpful when trying find the best of the island. She will definitely make you feel at home for your stay!

Carol's place was glorious! Great space and amenities. Beautiful deck, comfy furniture and very peaceful throughout. By far the best thing about it though is Carol. She is a fantastic host and is beyond thoughtful. Ex: One day I was lost trying to find a secluded beach. I texted a friend and then Carol by mistake. She called me & talked me through until I found the beach. Will be back soon! Mahalo for everything Carol!

Carol's place is excellent for someone who wants to be away from the herds of tourists. It is indeed a peaceful refuge as Carol calls it. The unit is very well ventilated and we slept very well here. Overall we enjoyed our stay  and were able to explore the west side of Big Island from here. Carol had great recommendations for us for the beaches to go see. We were able to cook a quick meal and enjoy it on the upstairs patio with the beautiful view of the ocean from there. Thanks Carol for hosting us!!

Carol's place is beautiful, colorful and perfectly located for a holiday in Kona! The place has an artistic touch, decorated with hand paintings on colorful walls. Carol has stocked the place with more amenities than you can find in the average Airbnb. Carol was friendly, warm and responsive to our questions. There is a small private garden in the back where we hung out and Carol's deck is also a great spot to watch the sunset. Her place is located at an ideal distance from great snorkeling spots around Kona, world class beaches 20 minutes North, and the lively Ali'i Drive with farmers markets, restaurants, bars and coffee shops.

A very relaxing stay at Carol’s place. Quiet neighborhood and very private. If you like walking for exercise your going to love the hills! I liked being adjacent to The family’s house for a feeling of safety yet with a private entrance. The bed was very comfortable. Carol is very friendly and helpful.
I’ll be back!
Had a great visit. Everything we needed was provided. Clean and safe.

This was our very first Airbnb experience and it was lovely.  Carol was a wonderful host - attentive, friendly, helpful.  The space was perfect and had everything we needed (and more).  Everything was clean and comfortable.  It was nice being a part of the neighborhood for a few days.  And the location was perfect for quick visits into town and very central for longer forays.  Many thanks, Carol, for sharing your space with us.

We loved Carol's cute, homey, and airy guest house. The breeze at night was lovely. And Carol recommended to us the best local snorkeling location too! She was friendly and warm, and we highly recommend her and her home.

If you're looking for a bright and happy centrally located slice of paradise, look no further. I was greeted by Carol who made sure the place was absolutely perfect and spotless for my arrival. Great vibe, private, and a straight shot into Kailua. As a former resident of Hawaii, I know Aloha when I see it, and that's what spending time here felt like. On a whim fresh cookies came out of the oven and I was offered some, and I was welcome to spend time on her lanai to see the ocean and relax. Perfect elevation and temperatures, slept like a baby.

Carols place was perfect for our last few days of our stay. Her place was very clean and open feeling. She went above and beyond to help us out and kept checking in on us to make sure we had everything we needed. We were really happy with the place and the hospitality.
The host canceled this reservation 18 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Carol’s place is wonderful. A great way for us to kick off our island visit. Bright, sunny, clean. Great space.
Nice place. Great host.
This is a very clean and pretty place that has everything you need.  It does not have a stove but has microwave and toaster oven.   It is very convenient to town as well as the airport.

Carol is a kind, caring and generous hostess.  Her home is charming, comfortable and convenient.  We would definitely recommend and consider staying with Carol again if we are fortunate to return to Kona.  We were able to enjoy and explore all that Kona has to offer (which is a lot) and avoid the touristy congestion of downtown when resting (which was much needed).
Great place. Loved the location. Carol was great. Loved going to sleep with the sounds of the jungle around me!

I really enjoyed my stay at Carols place. Everything was perfect. It’s a great place to stay for 1 person or a couple. It’s far enough up the mountain to stay cool at night, but only a short 5 minute drive to town and the beaches.
A great home base for exploring the west side, Carol was a great host and the apartment is stylish, cozy, and relaxing. We'll definitely come back!

Es war sehr liebevoll mit kleinen Details eingerichtet
Sie hat sich viel Zeit für Fragen genommen und war super hilfsbereit. Selbst in der Küche war Obst vorbereitet-super !

Appartement bien situe tres joliment decore
Hotesse tres arrangeante 
Seul petit bemol les chiens du voisin !

My stay here was outstanding, I can speak for me and my boyfriend when I say this. We slept like babies with all windows open feeling the natural breeze in our bright jungle room. The drive into the town of kona was perfect the location was truly prime. The island is wonderful and if your stay is here with Carol it will be better. Forever will be dreaming of this place.. until next time!

Next time we are on the big island, we will definitely come beach to Carol's place! 

Carol was a great host. She had good local tips and hike suggestions for us.  She was quick to answer any questions we had.   We used the grill and ate on the lovely shared patio.   The washer and dryer are in the garage. If you need to use them it's easy and nice.  She takes great care of the place, and it is warm and inviting. The unit is detached from the house and is private and charming. The house is three blocks from a road that turns into a main thoroughfare, which makes getting to other parts of the island easier too.  Overall this was an A+ experience.

I had a great experience staying at Carol's place. She and her son are very warm and welcoming and provided me with many details of local knowledge to help me in my move here to the big island. The place was very comfortable, up high away from the heat on ali'i drive, and centrally located to all the places I needed to go. Thank you Carol!!

Carol’s place is a lovely one from which to explore the greater Kona area. There is a great sunset view from her deck, and she has provided most everything you need. This place is a couple of miles out of Kona town proper so a car is helpful. Thank you, Carol for a perfect launching-pad for the rest of my magical Hawaiian week! Aloha
Thank you for hosting my doctor.  She found the place very cute, clean, and colorful.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed for four nights and  found it to be clean, comfortable and well equipped. This place has everything that is necessary. The view from the deck is amazing.  The location is perfect and is about 5-7 minutes drive to all restaurants and groceries stores. Carol couldn’t have been friendlier and most welcoming she is an amazing host which was more than appreciated when being so far from home. Would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.

I love staying at Carol’s place because of the location which is higher up on the hill, allowing cooler nights with melodious nature sound.  I slept very well and the shower had good water pressure. The decor in the room makes you feel happy and bright. Carol’s attention to details make me feel I was staying at a home away from home. The street parking was easy and the guesthouse is easily acessible by few steps.

I've stayed at many AirBnB's across the US and abroad and this was the worst experience I've ever had. When I arrived, the room was over 90 degrees and I found more than a dozen strands of hair in the shower and dozens of ants in the kitchen. When I told the host, she said this surprised her because the previous guest was very clean. Not sure why that would matter if hosts are supposed to clean up after each guest. 

I took photos of it all and said I wasn't comfortable staying there because of the condition of the room. This was the first time I've ever asked to cancel a reservation upon arriving. She wouldn't give a refund because she said it was too late for her to find someone else. Ultimately she seemed more concerned with making money than just human decency and cleanliness. This place also did not have a lock outside the room and it was clear someone went inside while I was gone (and without my consent). If I'm spending hard earned money on a vacation, I'd rather put it towards a business that values customer service. Throughout the ordeal, I found the host unpleasant to deal with and this was not how anyone should start their first trip to Hawaii. I would never stay here again knowing what I know now about the owner and how concerns are handled.
Pure loveliness. Cleanliness. Bathroom amenities. Snacks and drinks. A beautiful view of the ocean.

My stay at Carol's place was even better than expected.  I needed a relaxing, quiet, and reasonably priced location close to town for a week before my Ironman race, and her place was perfect.  Carol greeted me when I arrived and made sure I had everything that I needed, including suggestions of how to get around and what to do.  She even offered me some sparkling water while I sat and worked on my computer up on the patio one morning.  The inside space was light, airy and pleasant, with plenty of room to unpack and settle in for a week.

I had a rental car, which was perfect for the short run up and down the hill to town, and parking was easy right in front of her house.  The neighborhood was quiet and safe, the neighbors friendly and pleasant, and the sunset view beautiful.  I would definitely stay here again when I come back to Kona!

This place was wonderfully located to everything we wanted to see.  The kitchen was adequately supplied with frige, microwave, oversized toaster oven and a two-burner hot plate. We loved the coqui serenade every night.   Even though it was fairly warm (almost hot) down on Ali'i drive, it was nice and cool at this home away from home.  The lanai was a lovely spot to relax and look out at the ocean.  We loved talking to the other tenants.  Paul had a great many suggestions on activities and restaurants.  Thank you again for providing us a place to have a magical week.

Bring your Sherpa. First the good: Carol is a wonderful host, it's a great neighborhood, the place is bright, clean and centrally located - it's easy to get to town. The bad: It's painful to lock-up when going out. There are two entrances, a sliding door in the front and a side door in the back. Only the side door is lockable form the outside. To lock up, you need to exit the side door, walk down some steps around the back of the unit across the back yard, then around the other side and up a short but rather steep slope. There are what mayby were at some point steps. It's a rocky, narrow path around the side of the unit and up the slope. There is no handrail or a wall or anything to hold on to. Getting up was not an issue for me but getting down was a challenge (I'm not so young anymore). I expressed my concern to Carol and she told me It was safe to leave the sliding door unlocked when leaving and that no one had ever entered and taken anything. It is a very private space and no doubt very safe. But I was not comfortable leaving the unit unlocked. I travel with a fairly expensive laptop, if it were to be stolen, I don't want to tell the police "no, officer I didn't lock the door". I locked up every time i left.
Loved this beautiful home! Simple, sweet, and close by to the heart of Kona. Felt right at home when we arrived and were able to take advantage of the snorkel/beach gear during our stay!

Fabulous host! It is always the "little details" that tell the most. The "details" were attended to -- extra towels, shampoo, sunscreen, beach towels and chairs, snorkel equipment; also the fresh vases of flowers in each room, coffee and creamer along with fresh fruit and nuts!  The location is wonderful -- 15 minutes to airport, 10 minutes to downtown Kona, 10 minutes to Costco,  no matter what part of the island you are exploring it is easy to get on the road that  you need to be on from this location. 

The guesthouse is in a neighborhood, therefore "neighborhood sounds". If you are a light sleeper wear earplugs (I found the coqui sounds put me to sleep!). You can see the night sky from the windows and look at the stars from bed. The homeowners are quiet, kind and willing to provide suggestions on places to go and things to do.

When you stay at this wonderful guesthouse, say hi to my green friend; he came around each day to check on me! Carol is a wonderful host, kind and gracious; quick to respond.

Aloha and Mahalo!

name: Cedar House - Jacuzzi
summary: The Cedar House this a 1 bed and 1 bath, located 1 mnt from the beach named “Francemar” to surf  “P. do Atlântico” and 10 km south of Porto.  This is a place for dreamers to reset, reflect and create. Designed with a “rustic” pace in mind, our hope is that you enjoy every part of your stay; from listen bird singing by in the morning, choosing the perfect beach to go as the sun sets,  play some tennis or relaxing in the hot tube surrounded by over the field and a starry night sky.
space: Welcome to the Cedar House! This Chalet was built in 2006. With some Pinus pinea Trees on the property, the views from the house are magical. If you’re up for it, sunrise on the front porch is incredible.  This house is very close to small Miramar town famous for the "Capela Senhora da Pedra", a 17th century strikingly situated on a rocky, wave-beaten headland jutting out from the beach and many restaurants and coffees about 2 minutes walk from the house. If you’re looking for the sound of the sea waves and silent experience, we would recommend our property. From 9 kilometres Vila Nova de Gaia takes you back to the 17th century begginings of port-wine production, when British merchants transformed wine into the post-dinner tipple of choice by adding a dash of brandy. Their grande lodges sit imposingly astride the Douro, inviting you for tours of barrel-lined cellars, tastings, and dinner at rooftop terraces with twinkling views of the historic centre opposite.  There are one bedrooms a
description: The Cedar House this a 1 bed and 1 bath, located 1 mnt from the beach named “Francemar” to surf  “P. do Atlântico” and 10 km south of Porto.  This is a place for dreamers to reset, reflect and create. Designed with a “rustic” pace in mind, our hope is that you enjoy every part of your stay; from listen bird singing by in the morning, choosing the perfect beach to go as the sun sets,  play some tennis or relaxing in the hot tube surrounded by over the field and a starry night sky. Welcome to the Cedar House! This Chalet was built in 2006. With some Pinus pinea Trees on the property, the views from the house are magical. If you’re up for it, sunrise on the front porch is incredible.  This house is very close to small Miramar town famous for the "Capela Senhora da Pedra", a 17th century strikingly situated on a rocky, wave-beaten headland jutting out from the beach and many restaurants and coffees about 2 minutes walk from the house. If you’re looking for the sound of the sea waves and si
neighborhood_overview: The Cedar House its located in Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal. Miramar is a seaside town made up of Sportsmen, artists and explorers. In the town you will find locally owned and run restaurants, gardens, supermarkets, coffees and shops. There are many wonderful places to visit during your stay at the house including the  “Capela Senhora da Pedra”, a 17th century strikingly situated on a rocky, wave-beaten headland jutting out from the beach.,  a famous 9-hole golf course at Miramar Golf Club, surf at “Praia do Atlântico”.
notes: This house has old plumbing and has a septic system. PLEASE do not flush anything other than toilet paper.
transit: The seaside town Miramar is walking distance from the house (about 3 minutes walk). Driving around the town is incredibly easy as well. We’re about a 10 minutes drive to wine cellars of Douro river and about 15 minutes drive to the centre of Porto. By Train, it’s possible to catch train in Campanhã station, “Aveiro” line direct to “Francelos” station (about 20 minutes trip) from “Francelos” station it’s more 15 minutes walk until arrived.  Airports: You need to rent a car. Oporto, PT (OPO) -  18 minutes Lisbon, PT (LIS) – 2 hours 45 minutes Faro, PT (FAO) – 4 hours 52 minutes
access: While you're staying here, the house will be your private oasis. If you want play tennis its simple bring your Rackets and play with your family or friends.
interaction: While we will not be at the house during your stay, feel free to contact us with any questions! We also have a lot of local recommendations to share. We send our guests an illustrated pdf before their stay with some of our favorite local spots!

reviews.comments: The host canceled this reservation 13 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Local espetacular, calmo e silencioso. Consegue-se ouvir as ondas do mar. Boa estadia, 10min de carro do centro do Porto.

Great location, walking distance to beach and Dom Marisco restaurant. Secluded, ample and quiet space. No classic kitchen but a comfortable outdoor space with bbq, sink, table and bench. And there is a private tenniscourt right in front of the cottage that needs some tcl but is great to do some casual playing. The hot tub in the cottage is well maintained and clean, even though we didn‘t use it since it was very warm during our stay.
Estancia recomendable cerca de Oporto :-)!!!
Alojamiento en zona muy tranquila ,con todo lo necesario cerca , a solo 12 km de oporto ,perfecto para pasar unos dias en pareja . Recomendable.
Very nice for a small stay . But probably not so nice in the cold wether ...
Todo muy bn el trato , el sitio la gente muy amable ..
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

name: BEAUTIFULLY UPGRADED OCEANFRONT STUDIO
summary: GREAT LOCATION & OCEANFRONT VIEWS!! A beautifully upgraded and decorated studio unit with a spectacular OCEANFRONT view. Centrally located in West Maui you will find yourself close to a grocery store, the farmer's market, the fish market, shopping and many restaurant's. Depending on the tides the property provides a small beach out front that is great for swimming and snorkeling. Resort amenities include coin operated washers/dryers, BBQ grills, Pool, Jacuzzi, Sundeck and Gazebo.
space: This recently remodeled direct oceanfront STUDIO is located in beautiful West Maui along the North Ka'anapali coast, 7 minutes North of Lahaina. While relaxing on your private lanai, you have incredible views of the islands of Moloka'i and Lana'i. Even though this condo is on the 1st floor, it is above ground level, so you can leave you lanai doors open and take advantage of the breezy trade winds and the musical sounds of the pacific. The breathtaking Hawaiian sunsets will be a lasting memory. Listen to the local sounds announcing the sunset every evening, by the blowing of the conch shells up and down the coast line.  The tropical grounds of Paki Maui include a tranquil koi fishpond and waterfall that greets you make your way to the condo. The ocean front side of the condo/ lanai has a grassy lawn area of about 30 feet between you and the ocean. It's just perfect for sunbathing with lounge chairs and tables to help you relax. From the lawn area there are 5 or 6 steps that lead you to

Centrally located in West Maui you will find yourself close to a grocery store, the farmer's market, the fish market, shopping and many restaurant's. Depending on the tides the property provides a small beach out front that is great for swimming and snorkeling. The breathtaking Hawaiian sunsets will be a lasting memory. Listen to the l
neighborhood_overview: Paki Maui is centrally located in West Maui. You are close to a grocery store, the farmers market, fish market, shopping and many restaurant's. There is a small beach in front of the complex, but if you are looking for something larger there are several others in the area.
transit: We always recommend for you to have a rental car, but many places are within walking distance of this resort. You can also use the public bus transit system, a taxi service or Uber.
access: Guests' are welcomed to use what ever is in the unit, unless it's in a locked cabinet or closet.
interaction: This property is managed by Maui Beach Properties. We give our guests' their space, but if you should need assistance myself or Dave will be available to assist you.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours 10 PM - 8 AM - This is a non smoking unit. Please smoke at the designed smoking areas only. - Pets are not permited on property, except service animals. - Lanai and entrance areas are not to be used as a storage. This would include beach gear, bicycles, etc. - No fireworks at any time or on any occasion. VACATION RENTAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS: THE FOLLOWING TERMS & CONDITIONS ARE HEREBY REQUIRED FOR YOUR RESERVATION AGREEMENT. THIS IS A LEGAL DOCUMENT GOVERNED BY THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF HAWAII AND SHOULD BE READ CASREFULLY. Any revisions to this Reservation Agreement, made after confirmation is issued, must be in writing and is subject to MBP approval.  Check-in time is 3:00pm and Check-out time is 11:00am. Early Check-in or Late Check-outs need prior approval and will incur a fee.  AMENITIES & HOUSEKEEPING  MBP and the property Owner provide fully furnished accommodations. All applicable Departure Cleaning Fees do not include housekeeping services during your stay, howeve

reviews.comments: The unit we stayed in was great and Bree was extremely responsive and accommodating.  We would love to stay here again if we are lucky enough to visit Maui again.
Bree was amazing and the place is beautiful! It was a great vacation, thank you so much!!!

We stayed here for our honeymoon in Early December. It is a beautiful condo and just the right size for us! We enjoyed meeting other vacationers at the hot tub/pool area and cooking in (with a grill on sight near the pool!).  

The location is great if you are looking for a central West Maui spot - we were 10-15 minutes from Lahaina town, and the same from Napili. Great beaches all up and down, many with free parking and access. There is also a little beach right next door!

Bree was WONDERFUL and answered questions quickly. She was warm, friendly and professional in all of our communications. Excellent customer service!

Parking is free at Paki Maui and that was a huge plus. Right across the street are  several very casual dining options. This place is relaxed, easy and has a beautiful view from the Lanai. We had a wonderful time!
Fabulous place on the water. We came with a 3 month old and it worked out perfectly!

The absolute best location you could hope for on Maui, close to the best fish tacos and açaí bowls I’ve ever had and the oceanfront view from the studio is magical. Amazing value and will stay here every time I come back.

We had a fantastic stay at this condo.  The location, which was in the heart of local shops and restaurants, but away from the shiny resorts, was absolutely perfect for us.  There's a nice park next door with a beach and playground equipment, a grocery store a couple blocks away, and a fish market/restaurant right across the street that is busy all day long (always a good sign).  There are also lots of beautiful beaches within a handful of miles.  We werevery pleased to see that he condo itself was true to the pictures that were posted in the listing.  Very clean and nicely furnished.  We happened to arrive just as the sun was setting, and when we walked in for the first time and saw the view my husband and I both gasped.  And we're not gaspers.   Bree was attentive and available when needed.  We had an amazing trip and would definitely recommend this condo to fellow travelers.
As advertised. Great location.

It was a great place to stay and I still dream of waking up to the ocean sounds! There's no AC but who wants to close that door anyway?! There's fun helpful items like a cooler and snorkle gear (we saw a turtle about 300 feet from our Lanai!).
Awesome view! This is as close to the water as you can get!

Great Airbnb with amazing sunset views over the ocean! Loved enjoying cocktails on the lanai and keeping the sliding door open at night to listen to the waves. Great spot for those who are going to be exploring the island and do not plan to spend all their time at one beach!

We stayed in three locations and three different Airbnbs while we were at Maui (Lahaina, Paia, and Wailea).  Of all of our homes, this one had the best location right by the water.  My significant other and I wanted to have a nice relaxing vacation and we were debating between a resort and an Airbnb and were really happy with our choice here.  We appreciated waking up by the waters and having coffee and a homemade breakfast right on the balcony (honestly, I would have had to shell out so much more to get that kind of prime spot at a resort).  Would definitely stay here again! :)
We had very relaxing stay! Will definitely stay again!
a great place to stay, and a great location!

This place was amazing! The condo has a direct ocean view with an amazing view of the sunset and marine wildlife. Everything you need is there— beach towels, snorkel gear, extra sunscreen, coin laundry, and Bree even had an amazing guide to the must do’s for Maui and Lahaina. Many local restaurants are within a few minutes walk. We had an amazing time and can’t wait to return.
Great location.
Perfect space. Close to everything... grill, beach, pool. Local tips were great! Stylish and so clean!
Great place right on the ocean! Depending on the time of year you might see a giant turtle or two. Views are amazing, and Bree is a great, responsive, and adaptive host.

Truly an amazing experience! Would book with Bree without hesitation anytime! You’re not going to get a better ocean front experience anywhere in that area. We found it not worthwhile to eat out, when you can cook in the nice kitchen there and eat on the lanai. Better than any ocean front restaurant in Lahaina! With only the screen door closed at night you feel like you are sleeping on the ocean it’s that close. Can’t wait to go back!

Bree is awesome.  Prompt and clear communication, as well as extremely helpful in making sure you have what you need.  We loved our stay and working with Bree.  Highly recommend!  So many turtles, whales and sea life.  Go get some snorkels and have a blast swimming,  or just sit and watch fabulous sunsets.  I cant say enough!

name: Stylish apartment in the heart of Gothic area
summary: Nice apartment of two bedrooms, kitchen office and living room and a great private terrace. The apartment has one open concept bedroom with one double bed and another regular bedroom with twin beds. The unit counts with a private, beautiful and big terrace. ONLY MONTHLY RENTALS (Over 32 nights)
space: The apartment is in the heart of Gothic area, the part of Gothic and only at 2 minutes to Plaza Catalunya. Plaza Catalunya is the most central area in Barcelona. It is between Eixample area and Gothic-Ciutat Vella area, it has the best things ofthe two areas. Gothic area is the antique Barcelona, narrow streets, historic buildings, lovely shops and restaurants, Las Ramblas, the Port, Columbus monument, the Liceu opera, Palau de la Música, Museo Picasso, the Cathedral, Ciutadella gardens… All in all very charming and interesting. Eixample area is built 100 years ago in the modernistic years. There are many modernistic beautiful buildings, La Pedrera, Casa Batlló, smart clothes shops, Paseo de Grácia,… It is a very well communicated area. There are four metro lines (L1, L3, L4 y L6), train station, local train station and several bus lines. ONLY MONTHLY RENTALS (Over 32 nights)

The apartment has one open concept bedroom with one double bed and another regular bedroom with twin beds. The unit counts with a private, beautiful and big terrace. ONLY MONTHLY RENTALS (Over 32 nights) The apartment is in the heart of Gothic area, the part of Gothic and only at 2 minutes to Plaza Catalunya. Plaza Catalunya is the most central area in Barcelona. It is between Eixample area and Gothic-Ciutat Vella area, it has the best things ofthe two areas.
